0.title: Naughty boys of Koffee club should focus on films: Vivek Agnihotri
0.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri on Thursday indirectly reacted to an old video of him saying he eats beef. He wrote on Twitter, "I think the naughty boys of Koffee club should ask their SM agencies and PR firms to focus on their film rather than fighting the battle with me. I'm not the kind whom you can break with free hampers."

1.title: You've rested enough: Gambhir on Rohit being rested vs Afghanistan
1.article_body: Talking about Rohit Sharma being rested for the match against Afghanistan, Gautam Gambhir said, "You cannot be resting, you've...rested enough." "Rohit should...[play] every game from here on looking at the T20 World Cup," added Gambhir. Sharing his opinion on Virat Kohli scoring his first international hundred after nearly three years, Gambhir stated, "[Nobody] would've survived...this long."

2.title: Dogs around MP zoo given anti-rabies vaccine before arrival of cheetahs
2.article_body: Ahead of the arrival of cheetahs in Madhya Pradesh's Kuno National Park, over 1,000 dogs around the zoo have been administered the anti-rabies vaccine, an official said. The cheetahs, that are from Africa, will arrive at the zoo as part of India's project to reintroduce the animal. This was done to protect the cheetahs from rabies, the official added.

3.title: 102-yr-old man declared 'dead' dresses up as groom to prove he's alive in Haryana
3.article_body: A 102-year-old man staged a protest and dressed up like a groom to prove he's alive, claiming that his pension was stopped earlier this year on the ground that he was dead. Duli Chand undertook a procession to hand over a memorandum to officials, urging them to restore his pension. He also held a 'Your uncle is still alive' board.

4.title: Arunachal Assembly adopts Transplantation of Human Organ Act
4.article_body: Arunachal Pradesh Assembly on Thursday unanimously adopted the Transplantation of Human Organ Act, 1994 (Amendment Act 2011). "Adoption of this Act will be our first step towards creating suitable infrastructure for implementation, capacity building of hospital staff and doctors, advocacy for promoting deceased organ and tissue donation," Arunachal Health Minister Alo Libang said.

5.title: Winter is going to be hard on the battlefield in Ukraine: NATO chief
5.article_body: NATO Secretary-General Jens Stoltenberg warned that "winter is going to be hard on the battlefield in Ukraine" as "there's no sign of Russia giving up its goal of taking control of Ukraine". Stoltenberg said Ukraine is in urgent need of winter essentials as "the size of...Ukrainian army is now roughly three times as big as what it was last winter".

6.title: 4 trekkers from West Bengal missing in Kullu since Wednesday
6.article_body: Four trekkers from West Bengal have gone missing in Himachal Pradesh's Kullu district since Wednesday, said officials on Friday. They were trekking to Mount Ali Ratni Tibba. A cook and two others, who were part of the expedition, informed authorities about the missing men after returning to Wachem near Malana village, according to the State Disaster Management Authority (SDMA).

7.title: Kolkata-based Wow! Momo raises ₹125 cr from OAKS Asset Management
7.article_body: Kolkata-headquartered Wow! Momo raised around ₹125 crore from OAKS Asset Management at a valuation of ₹2,125 crore in its Series D round of funding. The company is set to raise another ₹100 crore from another venture capital fund in the next quarter, it said. Backed by Tiger Global, Wow! Momo was founded by Binod Homagai and Sagar Daryani in 2008.

8.title: PNC Infratech stock rises 3% after firm bags ₹1,458-cr NHAI project
8.article_body: After PNC Infratech said that it had signed an agreement with the National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) for a ₹1,458-crore project, its stock rose by nearly 3% to ₹294.95 apiece on BSE on Friday. PNC said it will work on the Sonauli-Gorakhpur section of NH-29E in Uttar Pradesh. At 11:45 am, its shares were trading at ₹294.05 on BSE.

9.title: Pic of 'bored' 4-year-old Charles at his mother Elizabeth II's coronation resurfaces
9.article_body: A picture showing 4-year-old Charles at Elizabeth II's coronation has resurfaced as he becomes the King after the demise of his mother. Commenting on the picture which was shared by the Royal Collection Trust on Instagram in 2019, a user wrote, "The kid's bored." In the picture, Charles is standing between his grandmother, and aunt Princess Margaret.

10.title: Gujarat Congress calls for bandh over jobs, inflation on Saturday
10.article_body: Gujarat Congress has called for a bandh in the state over inflation and unemployment on Saturday. The party appealed to traders and businesses to keep their shops closed from 8 am to 12 noon. Party's state chief Jagdish Thakor claimed that there are over 4.5 lakh registered unemployed youths in the state, while lakhs of government posts remain vacant.

11.title: Delhi govt begins prep for spraying decomposer to curb stubble burning
11.article_body: The Delhi government has started preparing to spray bio-decomposer on farmland to prevent stubble burning, said Delhi Environment Minister Gopal Rai. The decomposer will be sprayed free of cost on all basmati and non-basmati paddy fields in the city, Rai added. Last year, the government received applications for spraying the decomposer on around 4,300 acres of paddy fields in Delhi.

12.title: Tata Group in talks with Taiwanese supplier for JV to assemble iPhones in India: Report
12.article_body: Tata Group is in talks with Taiwanese supplier Wistron to establish a joint venture to assemble Apple's iPhones in India, Bloomberg reported. Apple began iPhone assembly in India in 2017 via Wistron and later with Foxconn. The plan could result in Tata Group buying equity in Wistron's India operations or two companies building a new assembly plant, the report added.

13.title: King Charles to now travel without passport, drive without licence, have 2 birthdays
13.article_body: UK's new king Charles III can travel without a passport and drive without a licence. As his birthday is on November 14, it's likely he'll have an 'official birthday' in a warmer month. He would also own all unmarked mute swans in England. He can grant Royal Warrants to companies/tradespeople. Burberry, Cadbury, Jaguar Cars are among companies with Royal Warrants.

14.title: Andhra Pradesh CM orders action against money lending apps after couple's suicide
14.article_body: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister YS Jagan Mohan Reddy has ordered for stringent action to be taken against online money lending apps for harassment of users. This comes after a city couple died by suicide following harassment by loan application agents. The Chief Minister also directed East Godavari district collector to provide financial assistance of ₹5 lakh each to victims' children.

15.title: Woman develops complications after family planning operation in Hyd, dies
15.article_body: A woman died after allegedly developing complications after undergoing a family planning operation in Hyderabad. Reports said that the woman passed away while undergoing treatment. However, reports added that the exact reason for the woman's death is not yet known and that the officials from the hospital have not issued any statement as of now.

16.title: Van falls into 120-ft-deep well in TN; 3 college students killed
16.article_body: Three college students were killed after a van they were travelling in plunged into a 120-foot-deep well in Tamil Nadu's Coimbatore on Friday, police said. According to the police, the well had over 80 feet of water and the college students drowned. The van's driver, who sustained injuries, was driving the vehicle in a rash and negligent manner, police added.

17.title: 25-year-old homeless woman gangraped by 3 near Gorakhpur station
17.article_body: A 25-year-old homeless woman was allegedly kidnapped and gangraped by three youths near Gorakhpur railway station in Uttar Pradesh, police said on Thursday. The victim was admitted to BRD Medical College after she reported the incident to the police, said SP (Railway) Awdhesh Singh. The suspects beat her and fled when she tried to raise an alarm, he added.

18.title: Bihar man jailed for wife's murder, police find her alive at dad's Nepal home
18.article_body: The wife of a man who was allegedly sent to jail for her murder in Bihar, was found alive and well at her maternal home in Nepal. Reports said that the woman's parents had accused her husband and her in-laws of burning their daughter alive. The police had launched an investigation even though the woman's husband had been jailed.

19.title: Had promising talks with Apple about Starlink: Musk on iPhone 14 SOS feature
19.article_body: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk on Thursday said the company had "promising conversations" with Apple regarding Starlink connectivity for iPhone 14's new satellite-powered SOS feature. "For sure, closing link from space to phone will work best if phone software and hardware adapt to space-based signals vs Starlink purely emulating cell tower," he added. Apple chose Globalstar's services to power the feature.

20.title: Pune's PCMC receives 69,032 applications for 386 permanent posts
20.article_body: Pune's Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) has received 69,032 job applications for 386 permanent posts. "The last date for applying is till 6 pm September 8," an official earlier said. Notably, recruitment for the posts is being carried out after nearly seven years. As many as 22,000 have applied for the 213 clerical posts and 21,000 for junior engineers posts.

21.title: Over 8,000 policemen to patrol Pune roads for Ganesh idol immersions today
21.article_body: More than 8,000 policemen will be patrolling Pune streets today for Ganesh idol immersions on the occasion of Anant Chaturdashi, an official said. Pune Police Commissioner Amitabh Gupta said CCTVs had been installed at various spots in the city. "Nearly 3,000 registered Ganesh pandals will carry out immersions. They will be allowed to play music only till midnight," he added.

22.title: 5 killed, 11 injured after jeep collides with truck in Rajasthan
22.article_body: Five people, including a child, died and 11 others were injured after the jeep they were travelling in collided with a truck in Rajasthan's Nagaur district on Thursday night. According to Circle Officer Jayal Rameshwar Lal, the accident occurred when the jeep was going to Sikar from Ramdevra temple in Jaisalmer. All passengers were residents of Ringas, Lal added.

23.title: OTT has horrible culture, takes months to get back: Prakash Jha
23.article_body: Filmmaker Prakash Jha has stated that OTT platforms have a horrible culture, adding that they take months to get back. "They say your film is a dry film, it is artsy and takes months to get back, sometimes not with positive answers," he added. The filmmaker further said the audience has a choice now and rejects films that aren't good.

24.title: All rumours are fake: Charmme on reports of Vijay's 'Jana...' being shelved
24.article_body: Actress-producer Charmme Kaur has addressed the reports of Vijay Deverakonda's 'Jana Gana Mana' being shelved after the box office failure of 'Liger'. She wrote on Twitter, "Rumours rumours rumours! All rumours are fake! Just focusing on the progress of Puri Connects. Meanwhile, RIP rumours!!" 'Jana Gana Mana' will feature Vijay as an army officer and co-stars Pooja Hegde.

25.title: Pic of elderly fan bowing down to Kohli moments after his 71st int'l hundred goes viral
25.article_body: A picture of an elderly fan bowing down to Virat Kohli from the stands just moments after his 71st international hundred has gone viral on social media. "Only Virat Kohli can make a man more than twice his age bow down to him," a fan tweeted. "This pic goes hard and deep!" wrote another. Kohli slammed 122*(61) against Afghanistan.

26.title: Congress fired missiles, I only retaliated with 303 rifle: Azad
26.article_body: Ghulam Nabi Azad, who recently resigned from the Congress, has criticised the party saying that they "fired missiles" on him but he only retaliated with a "303 rifle" and they were destroyed. "What would have happened had I used a ballistic missile?" he added. Earlier, Azad had said that he will launch a new party soon.

27.title: Inquiry ordered: Shinde on 'beautification' of terrorist Yakub's grave
27.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Thursday said that an inquiry has been ordered over the alleged beautification of terrorist Yakub Memon's grave. "Strict action will be taken against...persons responsible," he added. Earlier, BJP claimed that the previous state government under former CM Uddhav Thackeray was responsible. Memon was convicted in the 1993 Mumbai blasts case and was hanged in 2015.

28.title: BMC to renovate Mumbai's iconic Worli Fort, black basalt stone bought
28.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) will be giving the iconic Worli Fort a makeover, reports said. The civic body has also purchased black basalt stone for the renovation process. "We have just started work on the project...We will also illuminate it at night so that it becomes visible from the sea link," an official said.

29.title: UN chief arrives in flood-hit Pakistan, appeals for 'massive' help
29.article_body: UN Secretary-General António Guterres appealed to the world for "massive help" for flood-hit Pakistan as he arrived in the South Asian country on Friday for a two-day visit. The UN has launched an appeal for $160 million in aid to help Pakistan cope with the disaster, which has been blamed on climate change. The floods have killed over 1,390 people.

30.title: What multiple records did Virat Kohli break with his 71st international hundred?
30.article_body: Virat Kohli slammed 122*(61) against Afghanistan, his 71st international hundred. It's the highest individual T20I score by an Indian and the highest individual T20I score on UAE soil. It's also the first-ever hundred by a player in T20 Asia Cup. Kohli also became the fastest batter to reach 3,500 T20I runs (96 innings) and 24,000 international runs (522 innings).

31.title: Cricket looked incomplete without Virat Kohli scoring runs: Pakistan's Wahab Riaz
31.article_body: After Virat Kohli smashed his first international hundred after nearly three years, Pakistan's Wahab Riaz tweeted, "Cricket looked incomplete without Kohli scoring runs." He added, "Good to see the run machine back. Enjoyed the Kohli show." Kohli scored 122*(61) against Afghanistan on Thursday, his first T20I hundred. Kohli has now slammed hundreds against 10 nations in international cricket.

32.title: Who have been the world's longest serving monarchs?
32.article_body: Queen Elizabeth II who passed away aged 96 is second on the list of world's longest serving monarchs. Louis XIV of France who reigned for over 72 years is at the top. Queen overtook Thailand's King Bhumibol Adulyadej, who is third on the list, in June this year. Austrian Emperor Franz Joseph, who reigned for nearly 68 years, is fourth.

33.title: Harsha Engineers sets price band at ₹314-330 apiece for Sept 14 IPO
33.article_body: Harsha Engineers International has set a price band of ₹314-₹330 a share for its initial public offering (IPO) that will open for subscription on September 14 and close on September 16. The anchor book will open on September 13. The IPO comprises fresh issue of ₹455 crore and offer for sale of up to ₹300 crore by shareholders and promoters.

34.title: Have they lost their minds? I was so angry: Miandad on Afghanistan
34.article_body: Discussing the behaviour of the Afghanistan cricketers in their match against Pakistan, ex-Pakistan captain Javed Miandad said, "Do they consider themselves bigger? They haven't even started playing cricket. Have they lost their minds?" "I was so angry...with the way they were behaving," added Miandad. "They have learnt from us. I have personally given them coaching," he stated.

35.title: Demolition of Goa's Curlies, linked to death of Sonali Phogat, put on hold by SC
35.article_body: The Supreme Court on Friday stayed the demolition of Goa's Curlies shack subject to the condition that no commercial activities will take place there. It was being razed for allegedly flouting the coastal zone regulations. This comes days after BJP leader and TikTok star Sonali Phogat was allegedly drugged at a party in Curlies hours before her death.

36.title: What is the British Royal family's new line of succession after Queen's death?
36.article_body: With the passing of Queen Elizabeth, her son Charles accedes to the throne and becomes King, creating a shift in the line of succession underneath him. Once second in line to the throne, Charles' elder son William is now the heir to the throne. William's son George, is now second in line and his daughter Charlotte is third in line.

37.title: UP govt offers to bear patient's treatment cost after son appeals to Dy CM
37.article_body: Kaushambi district administration has offered to bear the treatment expenses of the father of an 11-year-old boy after the latter appealed to UP Deputy CM Keshav Prasad Maurya. "The officials of the district hospital have been asked to submit an estimate of his treatment which will be sent to the office of the Deputy CM," Kaushambi DM Sujeet Kumar said.

38.title: Punjab policeman misbehaves as man refuses to give him ride, transferred
38.article_body: A policeman deployed in Ludhiana Civil Hospital was transferred after he allegedly misbehaved with a city resident. Reports said the policeman allegedly asked the resident for ride to a spot near Clock Tower. The resident said he was in a hurry and refused to drive him. Police said the policeman was heavily drunk, as found by doctors during medical checkup.

39.title: End of an era: Riteish, Sushmita, Anushka on Queen Elizabeth's demise
39.article_body: Bollywood celebrities like Riteish Deshmukh, Sushmita Sen, Anushka Sharma and Kareena Kapoor took to social media to condole the demise of Queen Elizabeth II. Riteish tweeted, "End of an era!! Through the toughest times she never let [go] of her dignity." Sushmita shared a picture of her, writing, "What an incredible & truly celebrated life...The very embodiment of QUEEN!!!"

40.title: Everyone wants me to run again for US President in 2024: Trump
40.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump said that everyone wants him to run again for President in 2024, adding that he is "leading in the polls". "I'll make a decision in the very near future, I suspect...And I think...a lot of people will be [happy] and a couple of people will be unhappy," Trump told NDTV in an interview.

41.title: EU to introduce cybersecurity rules for smart devices: Report
41.article_body: With mounting concerns about cybersecurity attacks, the European Commission will reportedly announce its proposal for smart devices like TVs and refrigerators which are connected to internet to comply with European Union's cybersecurity rules. The Cyber Resilience Act is likely to become law after input from EU countries. Those companies which don't comply could be fined or banned from the bloc.

42.title: Thankful you're my bestest friend: Shilpa pens note on Raj Kundra's b'day
42.article_body: Actress Shilpa Shetty on Friday took to Instagram to share a video montage of Raj Kundra to mark his birthday. She wrote in the caption, "I'm thankful that you're my bestest friend, the father of my children, my love and my strength. Happy birthday, my Cookie." Raj has been released on bail over a pornography films case.

43.title: Can we stop with ageist headlines, comments: Leonardo's ex-girlfriend
43.article_body: Actor Leonardo DiCaprio's ex-girlfriend Kristen Zang wrote an op-ed for People Magazine criticising the "ageist headlines and comments" against his ex-girlfriends. Kristen wrote, "I read...headlines and...comments with his most recent ex-girlfriend being..."aged out" or being "too old for Leo at 25"...I think we can and should do better...But let's keep the funny memes coming, they're stellar."

44.title: 3 people killed, 3 injured as car falls into gorge in Rishikesh
44.article_body: Three people were killed and as many were injured after the car they were travelling in fell into a gorge near Brahmapuri on the Rishikesh-Badrinath road on Friday, said police. They were on their way to the Badrinath Dham, according to a police official. The injured persons were rescued and taken to a government hospital in Rishikesh.

45.title: UP govt to create 300-km long immune belt to check spread of lumpy virus
45.article_body: To check the spread of the lumpy virus disease, the Uttar Pradesh government has decided to create a 300-km long "immune belt" from Pilibhit to Etawah. The "immune belt" will pass through 23 blocks of five districts and will be 10 km wide. The Animal Husbandry Department has completed preparations regarding the same.

46.title: KRK's son claims his father is being tortured, says 'sister & I will die without him'
46.article_body: Days after Kamaal Rashid Khan (KRK) was arrested in Mumbai, his 23-year-old son Faisal tweeted that some people are "torturing to kill" his father. Requesting Abhishek Bachchan, Riteish Deshmukh and Devendra Fadnavis for help, he said, "I am just 23 years old living in London. I don't know how to help my father...Me n my sister will die without him."

47.title: Alia has become a trade analyst: Ranbir on 'Brahmāstra' advance bookings
47.article_body: On being asked about the advance bookings of 'Brahmāstra', actor Ranbir Kapoor stated that his wife actress Alia Bhatt is the most excited. "She is a trade analyst now. She is noting everything, this much is open here, this is the response there," he added. Ranbir further said they cannot take the figures seriously until the audience watches the film.

48.title: Iga Świątek becomes the 1st Polish woman to reach US Open final
48.article_body: World number one Iga Świątek became the first Polish woman to reach the US Open final, after defeating 2021 semi-finalist Aryna Sabalenka 3-6, 6-1, 6-4 in the semi-finals. "She was really aggressive on the second serve. She was putting pressure," said Świątek. "Honestly, I wasn't expecting too much from myself because Aryna is a great server," she added.

49.title: Noida Police bans private drones during World Dairy Summit
49.article_body: The Gautam Buddha Nagar Police on Thursday passed an order banning the operation of drones by private individuals and organisations till September 15 across Noida and Greater Noida. The ban has been ordered in view of the World Dairy Summit scheduled to begin in Greater Noida on September 12. Notably, PM Narendra Modi is expected to inaugurate the summit.

50.title: Electric scooter owner fined over pollution certificate in Kerala; challan pic viral
50.article_body: An electric scooter owner was fined by the Kerala Traffic Police for not having a valid Pollution Under Control (PUC) certificate. The photos of the vehicle and the e-challan issued by the police went viral on social media platforms. Social media users have appealed to Union Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari to look into the issue.

51.title: They're superstars, I was nervous: Siddhant on working with Deepika, Katrina
51.article_body: Speaking about working with actresses Deepika Padukone and Katrina Kaif, actor Siddhant Chaturvedi said that they are two distinct superstars. "For me, every film is a first film, I have worked with Ranveer and Alia in my first and then Deepika and Katrina," he said. The actor further said that he was very nervous to work with Katrina at first.

52.title: TMC workers can crush hands if BJP workers point finger: Kalyan Banerjee
52.article_body: TMC leader Kalyan Banerjee said if anyone from the BJP points a finger at anyone from TMC, the TMC workers can "crush those hands". "Didi (Mamata Banerjee) asked me to remain calm; that is why we have maintained a peaceful atmosphere. But if a BJP leader or a worker...threatens to break our hands...TMC workers can crush those hands," he added.

53.title: India slips 2 places on HDI, stays ahead of Pak but behind B'desh
53.article_body: India slipped two places on the Human Development Index (HDI) in a year, from 130 in 2020 to 132 in 2021, according to a UNDP report released on Thursday. India's HDI value stood at 0.633 during 2021. It stayed ahead of Pakistan, which was ranked 161st, but trailed Bangladesh, which stood on the 129th position.

54.title: World leaders pay tribute to UK's Queen Elizabeth II
54.article_body: World leaders paid tribute to UK's Queen Elizabeth II, who died on Thursday. French President Emmanuel Macron called her "a kind-hearted Queen" who was "a friend of France". Canadian PM Justin Trudeau said Queen was one of his favourite people in the world. She had been a "wise and enduring presence" in Australia's national life, Australian PM Anthony Albanese said.

55.title: 4-storey building collapses in Delhi's Azad market, 4 injured
55.article_body: As many as four persons were injured after a four-storey building collapsed in Delhi's Azad market area on Friday morning. No casualties have been reported till now, DCP (North) Sagar Singh Kalsi said. At least five persons are trapped under debris at the building collapse site, the Fire Department said earlier. The rescue operation is underway, it added.

56.title: Video shows Goa's Curlies being demolished days after Sonali Phogat was drugged there
56.article_body: A video showing the Curlies shack in Goa's Anjuna being demolished for allegedly flouting the coastal zone regulations has surfaced online. The video shows bulldozers and workers taking down the structure. The order for demolition came days after BJP leader and TikTok star Sonali Phogat was allegedly drugged at a party in Curlies hours before her death.

57.title: 102-yr-old man declared 'dead', dresses as groom to meet officials in Haryana
57.article_body: A 102-year-old man dressed up as a groom and took out a wedding procession to meet officials to prove that he is alive in Haryana's Rohtak after he was allegedly declared dead in government records and his old-age pension was stopped. One of the placards the man's supporters carried read- "Thara fufa abhi zinda hai (your uncle is still alive)".

58.title: Central Vista Avenue to have 4,000+ trees, heritage Jamun trees preserved
58.article_body: The revamped Central Vista Avenue will have over 4,000 different trees, reports said, adding that heritage Jamun trees have been preserved. Officials of the Central Public Works Department said that the Central Vista Avenue earlier had 3,890 trees and with new additions, the number now stands at 4,008. Officials added that 47 trees were transplanted within premises and 22 outside.

59.title: New batch for IIM I’s IPBA program starts on September 24: UNext Jigsaw
59.article_body: UNext Jigsaw shared that IIM Indore's 14th batch of online Integrated Program in Business Analytics (IPBA) will commence on September 24 covering in-demand subjects with 10+ graded assignments, industry-relevant case studies & capstone projects where students can gain access to an alumni network of 7000 professionals. 83% of IPBA students have achieved an average salary hike of 48%, it said.

60.title: 24,000 policemen, 739 extra CCTVs in Hyd to monitor Ganesh Visarjan
60.article_body: Over 24,000 police personnel and 122 platoons of reserve police have been deployed in Hyderabad as part of the security arrangements for Ganesh idol immersions on Friday and Saturday. As many as 739 additional CCTV cameras have been installed to monitor the routes through which the main procession will pass. Ten drone cameras are also being used.

61.title: Markets open in green with Sensex above 60,000, Nifty at 17,900
61.article_body: Benchmark indices opened in the green on Friday with Sensex rising 345.55 points to 60,033.77 and Nifty at 17,902.80, up by 104 points. IndusInd Bank, ICICI Bank, SBI, HUL and Tata Steel were among the major gainers. All sectoral indices opened at a high with Nifty Bank and Nifty Metal topping the charts.

62.title: realme announces offers worth ₹700 crore for realme Festive Day sale
62.article_body: realme announced the realme Festive Days sale with offers worth ₹700 crore, including up to ₹15,000 discount on smartphones and up to ₹12,000 discount on AIoT products. Users can avail discounts through realme.com, Flipkart, Amazon, & mainline stores. It also introduced the realme Savings Pass, redeemable after the sale goes live for benefits worth ₹1000, plus additional benefits.

63.title: Congress broke India, BJP unifying it: Biren Singh on 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'
63.article_body: While commenting upon Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', Manipur CM N Biren Singh alleged that the party broke India and BJP is unifying it. "If they (Congress) had removed Article 370 from Jammu and Kashmir...people would have believed that they want to unite India. But it was abrogated by...BJP," Singh added. Congress launched the yatra from Kanniyakumari on September 7.

64.title: Andhra couple kills self after harassment over loan, call cousin before death
64.article_body: A couple from Andhra Pradesh allegedly died by suicide on their daughter's birthday after being harassed over the repayment of a loan, reports said. The woman also called her cousin minutes before ending her life to request him to take care of their children. The loan application officials allegedly threatened to post the woman's morphed pictures online.

65.title: 3 get life term for burning alive Nashik additional district collector in 2011
65.article_body: A sessions court sentenced three men to life imprisonment for burning alive a former Nashik additional district collector, Yashwant Sonawane. The 46-year-old deceased was assaulted, sprayed with kerosene and burnt alive for objecting to oil adulteration in Manmad in 2011. The three were employees of the main accused, who had rented a 'dhaba' where the oil adulteration was taking place.

66.title: That smile? Priceless: Sunil Chhetri on Virat Kohli's celebration after scoring hundred
66.article_body: After Virat Kohli slammed his first international hundred in nearly three years, Indian men's football team captain Sunil Chhetri tweeted, "You can delay class all you want to...don't even think of denying it." He added, "That ton? Worth its weight in gold. That smile? Priceless. Shine on...champ." Kohli was seen smiling and kissing his engagement ring while celebrating his ton.

67.title: Mumbai Dabbawalas mourn Queen's demise, say 'had close relation with Royals'
67.article_body: The Mumbai Dabbawala Association has condoled the death of Queen Elizabeth II. "Mumbai Dabbawala Association has had a very close relationship with British Royal Family ever since Prince Charles visited India. We're very sad to hear about the death of Queen Elizabeth II and all Dabbawalas pray that her soul rests in peace," Subhash Talekar, Association Chairman, said.

68.title: Pelé shares old pics with Queen Elizabeth II, says 'I have been a great admirer'
68.article_body: Brazilian football legend Pelé penned a note after the demise of Queen Elizabeth II. Sharing pictures, he wrote, "I've been a great admirer of Queen Elizabeth II since the first time I saw her in person, in 1968, when she came to Brazil." He added, "A few years later...she generously awarded me...Order of the British Empire, the country's highest honor."

69.title: Karthik bowls for 1st time in his international career, gives away 18 runs in 6 balls
69.article_body: Team India wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik on Thursday bowled for the first time ever in his international career. The 37-year-old came to bowl the 20th over of Afghanistan's innings in their Asia Cup 2022 Super 4 stage match. He gave away 18 runs in the over, including two sixes. Karthik bowled off-spin deliveries.

70.title: India bans exports of broken rice, imposes 20% tax on non-basmati
70.article_body: India, the world's biggest rice exporter, has prohibited exports of broken rice and imposed a 20% levy on shipments of unmilled, semi-milled, wholly-milled and husked brown varieties from Friday, the government said. Some exports will, however, be allowed till September 15 with some conditions. The move will reportedly increase supplies and tame soaring local prices after below-average monsoons.

71.title: Ons Jabeur becomes 1st North African, Arab and Tunisian woman to reach US Open final
71.article_body: World number five Ons Jabeur of Tunisia defeated Caroline Garcia of France 6-1, 6-3 in the women's singles semi-finals to reach the US Open final for the first time. With this, she became the first North African, Arab and Tunisian woman to reach the US Open final. It's Jabeur's second straight Grand Slam final after finishing runner-up at Wimbledon 2022.

72.title: Rainbows appear over Buckingham Palace, Windsor Castle after Queen's death; pics viral
72.article_body: Rainbows appeared in UK after the demise of Queen Elizabeth II aged 96. A rainbow was spotted next to Windsor Castle, the Queen's residence in the English county of Berkshire. A double rainbow was seen over the Buckingham Palace. Reacting to the viral pictures, a social media user wrote, "Couldn't be more appropriate. May she rest in peace."

73.title: Staff bypassed us to cater her: Ishaan on Katrina's entry on 'Phone Bhoot' set
73.article_body: While talking about actress Katrina Kaif's entry on the set of 'Phone Bhoot', actor Ishaan Khatter said that "everything fell silent". "People were talking in hushed tones, and the aura just changed. There were staff literally bypassing us to go cater to her," he said, adding that everything was in chaos before Kaif entered the set.

74.title: Bengaluru reports 262 new COVID-19 cases, no deaths
74.article_body: Bengaluru reported 262 new COVID-19 infections in a day, taking the cumulative total to 18,67,742 cases, Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) Chief Commissioner said on Thursday. No new deaths were reported, so the overall toll remained at 16,983. The number of active cases was 2,746, while the infection positivity rate stood at 3.01%.

75.title: No Ganpati Visarjan at Mumbai's Sanjay Gandhi National Park: Bombay HC
75.article_body: The Bombay High Court on Thursday directed the Maharashtra government to ensure that there is no immersion of Ganesh idols inside Sanjay Gandhi National Park (SGNP) in Mumbai. "If any attempt is made in breach of law then...forest authorities are free to take appropriate steps,'' the bench said. The order came following a PIL filed by city-based NGO 'Mumbai March'.

76.title: India reports 6,093 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 49,636
76.article_body: India has reported 6,093 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 6,395 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in India stand at 49,636, while the death toll has risen to 5,28,121, according to the latest data.

77.title: Twitter agreed to pay $7 million to whistleblower in June: Report
77.article_body: Twitter agreed in June to pay about $7 million to the whistleblower whose allegations will be part of Elon Musk's case against the company, the Wall Street Journal reported. The whistleblower, Peiter "Mudge" Zatko, accused the social media firm of falsely claiming it had a solid security plan and making misleading statements about its defences against hackers and spam accounts.

78.title: Pet dog bites off chunk of boy's face in Ghaziabad; pic shows him after 150 stitches
78.article_body: A pet pitbull bit off a chunk of 11-year-old boy's face in Ghaziabad recently, following which the boy was hospitalised and received around 150 stitches. The boy's father said that the dog attacked the boy in a park after the dog's leash slipped from its owner's hand. The dog's owner has been fined ₹5,000 for not registering the dog.

79.title: Show us proof: Russia on US' claim Moscow seeking arms from N Korea
79.article_body: The US and the UK should provide proof to support their allegations that Moscow was seeking drones from Iran and rockets and artillery shells from North Korea to use in Ukraine, Russia's UN Ambassador said, addressing the UN Security Council. "Either provide us with evidence or acknowledge that you are disseminating unreliable information," Ambassador Vassily Nebenzia said on Thursday.

80.title: ED raids premises of Punjab AAP MLA Jaswant Singh Majra: Reports
80.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED) reportedly raided the premises of Aam Aadmi Party's Punjab MLA Jaswant Singh Gajjan Majra. ED reportedly carried out searches at Tara Haveli in Sangrur, Tara Convent School, Tara Golden Homes and Tara Feed Industry in Malerkotla, all linked to Majra. This comes four months after CBI raided his three Sangrur-located properties in an alleged bank fraud case.

81.title: 22-yr-old student dies by suicide after failing NEET-UG in Gr Noida
81.article_body: A 22-year-old female student allegedly died by suicide at her society in Greater Noida's Sector-151 on Thursday after she failed her NEET-UG exam. The deceased was stressed after failing the exam and her body has been sent for post-mortem, according to the police. This comes after a 19-year-old girl allegedly died by suicide in Chennai after failing the NEET-UG exam.

82.title: Biden signs condolence book for Queen Elizabeth II at UK embassy
82.article_body: US President Joe Biden and First Lady Jill Biden visited the British Embassy in Washington DC to sign a condolence book for Queen Elizabeth II. "We mourn for all of you. She was a great lady. I'm so delighted I got to meet her," Biden told embassy staff after signing the book. The Queen, Britain's longest-serving monarch, died on Thursday.

83.title: Govt offices, schools in Hyd to be closed today for Ganpati Visarjan
83.article_body: Telangana announced a holiday for government offices, schools and colleges in and around the twin cities of Hyderabad and Secunderabad, Ranga Reddy and Medchal-Malkajgiri districts on account of Ganesh idols immersion processions on Friday. The government added that November 12, which is the second Saturday, will be a working day in lieu of the holiday on Friday.

84.title: Pune civic body arranges 204 mobile tanks for immersion of idols
84.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation has arranged 204 mobile tanks and 303 artificial ponds in the city for the immersion of Ganesh idols on Friday. The civic body is also collecting idols at 216 places and along with an NGO, it is also collecting 'nirmalya', the flowers offered to Lord Ganesh. The flowers will be used to prepare fertilisers.

85.title: First he was Rumi with long hair: Ayan on Ranbir's Brahmastra character Shiva
85.article_body: Filmmaker Ayan Mukerji took to Instagram to share a picture of actor Ranbir Kapoor from an early look test for 'Brahmastra'. He revealed that Kapoor's character who is now named Shiva was earlier called Rumi. "First, he was Rumi. Rumi with long hair...we gave Ranbir a haircut, and Rumi became...Shiva," he wrote in the caption.

86.title: 4-yr-old swept away in drain following heavy rain in Thane, search underway
86.article_body: A four-year-old boy was swept away in a drain on a waterlogged street in Thane's Kalwa area following heavy rainfall on Thursday. According to Regional Disaster Management Cell (RDMC) chief Avinash Sawant, water in the locality was around four feet deep. "We...got...information about a four-year-old who was feared drowned and a search operation has been initiated," Sawant added.

87.title: Amritsar-born Devika Bulchandani appointed CEO of global advertising agency Ogilvy
87.article_body: Amritsar-born Devika Bulchandani has been appointed as the Global Chief Executive Officer of advertising agency Ogilvy, which has presence in 93 countries. Devika, who was serving as Global President and CEO of Ogilvy North America, succeeds Andy Main who is stepping down as Global CEO and will serve as a Senior Advisor until the end of the year.

88.title: Anushka shares pics of Kohli after he hits ton, says 'Forever with you through everything'
88.article_body: Anushka Sharma took to Instagram to share pictures of Virat Kohli celebrating after slamming his first international hundred in nearly three years. "Forever with you through any and everything," she wrote. Kohli dedicated his hundred to Anushka and their daughter Vamika. Kohli scored 122*(61) against Afghanistan on Thursday, his first-ever T20I hundred.

89.title: ABD shares pic with Kohli on scooter, says 'With his 100 I thought I’d share this memory'
89.article_body: Ex-South Africa captain AB de Villiers on Thursday took to social media to share an old picture of himself with Virat Kohli on a scooter. He captioned the picture, "With his 100 today...I thought I'd share this memory...Top knock...my friend. Many more to come." "Thanks biscuit. Love you," Kohli commented on his post. Meanwhile, Anushka Sharma commented, "Oh my god."

90.title: What is Operation Unicorn, activated in UK after Queen's death?
90.article_body: Funeral plans for UK Queen Elizabeth II codenamed 'London Bridge' were leaked in the media last year, however, due to her demise in Scotland, it was codenamed to 'Operation Unicorn', according to reports. The day of Queen's death will be referred to as D-Day. As a part of the operation, BBC presenters wore black and channels switched to rolling news.

91.title: 'Chor Raja' wanted in over 100 cases arrested by Pune Police
91.article_body: Pune Police arrested a criminal, identified as Rajesh Ram Papul aka 'Chor Raja', who was wanted in over 100 cases. Following his arrest from his house, the 37-year-old criminal has been remanded to police custody till September 12. It was only after installing a GPS machine in his fiancée's footwear that police were able to arrest him, an officer said.

92.title: Govt to form authority to manage traffic in Bengaluru: CM Bommai
92.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Thursday said that an authority will be formed to manage traffic in Bengaluru and that a bill to this effect will be introduced in the upcoming Assembly session. He added that several tasks are being undertaken by NHAI, BBMP, PWD and other departments and a comprehensive master plan will resolve most of the problems.

93.title: It was quite shocking for me that my 60s became failures: Virat Kohli on criticism
93.article_body: Referring to criticism he faced during his 1,019-day international century drought, Virat Kohli said, "What actually surprised me was my 60s became failures which was quite shocking for me." He added, "I was...batting pretty well and contributing but it didn't seem to be good enough. Kohli slammed a hundred after 1,019 days on Thursday, registering 122*(61) against Afghanistan.

94.title: Video of Kohli telling Bhuvneshwar 'Abhi hai cricket baaki' after smashing ton goes viral
94.article_body: A video of Team India batter Virat Kohli telling his teammate Bhuvneshwar Kumar 'Abhi hai cricket baaki (There's still cricket left)' after smashing a hundred after nearly three years has gone viral. Kohli made the remark when he was being greeted by his teammates following India's innings against Afghanistan in their Asia Cup 2022 Super 4 stage match on Thursday.

95.title: What will be the new Royal titles of Queen's son Charles, Prince William and Kate?
95.article_body: After the death of Queen Elizabeth II, her son Charles will be crowned King Charles III. Charles' son Prince William, and William's wife are now titled Duke and Duchess of Cornwall and Cambridge. William will not automatically become Prince of Wales - that will have to be conferred on him by his father. Charles' wife, Camilla, becomes the Queen Consort.

96.title: Mumbai witnesses heavy rain, IMD predicts thunderstorms; yellow alert issued
96.article_body: Mumbai received heavy rainfall on Thursday. The India Meteorological Department has predicted thunderstorms with lightning, light to moderate rainfall and gusty winds in the city. A yellow alert was also issued for Mumbai. The rainfall started at around 4:30 pm and intensified between 5 to 6 pm. Reports said that rail and road traffic was affected due to rains.

97.title: Noida Power Company Limited employee electrocuted during repair work
97.article_body: A man working with the Noida Power Company Limited was electrocuted to death while repairing power lines in Sector 10. "Another lineman told us that the power on the line he was fixing was shut...line he was working on became live," the deceased's nephew said. The line that the man was working on was switched on suddenly, the nephew added.

98.title: Congress leader Siddaramaiah visits flooded areas in B'luru on boat
98.article_body: Senior Congress leader Siddaramaiah on Thursday took a boat ride to the flood-affected areas in Bengaluru and interacted with the locals. He met the residents of Epsilon residential complex in Yemalur, which is home to some of the biggest entrepreneurs in Bengaluru. Further, he visited the residence of the 23-year-old woman who was recently electrocuted to death in Bengaluru.

99.title: There was nobody like her: Donald Trump on Queen Elizabeth II's demise
99.article_body: Condoling Queen Elizabeth II's demise, former US President Donald Trump said, "What a grand and beautiful lady she was—there was nobody like her!" He further said, "Melania and I will always cherish our time together with the Queen, and never forget Her Majesty’s generous friendship, great wisdom, and wonderful sense of humor."

100.title: Joe Biden releases statement on Queen Elizabeth II's demise, says 'She defined an era'
100.article_body: US President Joe Biden and First Lady Jill Biden released a statement following the demise of Queen Elizabeth II. "[She] was more than a monarch. She defined an era," the statement read. "She stood in solidarity with...US during our darkest days after 9/11...when she poignantly reminded us that 'Grief is the price we pay for love'," the statement added.

101.title: Need more opportunities for Indian startups' ideas to go global: Goyal
101.article_body: Speaking in the US, Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal said that Indian startups need more opportunities so that their ideas can reach out to the global market and stated that "Silicon Valley is the best place for an idea to go global". He added that the government is playing the role of facilitator between Indian startups and US-based investors.

102.title: Neeraj Chopra creates history, becomes first-ever Indian to win Diamond Trophy
102.article_body: Olympic gold medal-winning Indian javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra has created history by becoming the first-ever Indian to win Diamond Trophy. The 24-year-old won the Diamond League final in Zurich with a best throw of 88.44 metres. Apart from the Diamond Trophy, Neeraj also won a prize money of $30,000.

103.title: Target drops mandatory CEO retirement age, Cornell to stay for 3 more yrs
103.article_body: US-based merchandise retailer Target has dropped the mandatory retirement age for its CEO. This would allow CEO Brian Cornell to serve the position for three more years. Under Cornell's leadership, who took the position in 2014, the chain has expanded its customer base and accelerated its curbside pickups, online and same-day services.

104.title: Starbucks to rehire 7 fired Memphis workers after losing appeal
104.article_body: Starbucks will rehire seven employees who were fired after leading an effort to unionise Memphis store. Starbucks, which opposes unionisation, said employees violated company policy by reopening the store post-closing time and inviting non-employees. The National Labour Relations Board said Starbucks was interfering with workers' right to organise and asked a federal court in Memphis to intervene.

105.title: Friday's play in 3rd England-SA Test to not take place due to Queen Elizabeth II's demise
105.article_body: The second day's play in the third England-South Africa Test at Kennington Oval in London will not take place on Friday as scheduled due to the demise of Queen Elizabeth II, the England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB) announced. Further, all scheduled matches in the Rachael Heyhoe Flint Trophy, will also not take place on Friday.

106.title: Nothing more noble than to devote life to service of others: Tim Cook on Queen's demise
106.article_body: Apple CEO Tim Cook took to Twitter to condole the demise of Queen Elizabeth II. He wrote, "There's nothing more noble than to devote your life to the service of others. We stand with the people of the UK and Commonwealth in honoring the life and dedication to duty of her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II."

107.title: King Charles issues statement after Queen's death, says 'Her loss will be deeply felt'
107.article_body: Following Queen Elizabeth II's demise, her son King Charles said, "The death of my beloved Mother, Her Majesty The Queen, is a moment of the greatest sadness for me and all members of my family." "I know her loss will be deeply felt throughout the country, the Realms and the Commonwealth, and by countless people around the world," he added.

108.title: Not my career or personal goal: Idris Elba on playing James Bond
108.article_body: Idris Elba said playing James Bond is not a goal for his career and he doesn't think it will "satisfy some of my personal goals". However, he said if he's cast as the spy, it'll "definitely satisfy the will of a nation". Idris added, "I'm not that guy, but in everyone's world I might be. And that - job done."

109.title: Yami Gautam's 'Lost' to open Chicago South Asian Film Festival
109.article_body: Actress Yami Gautam's upcoming film 'Lost' will serve as the opening film at the Chicago South Asian Film Festival (CSAFF). Reacting to the news, Yami said she "can't be happier and more proud". Yami said working on the Aniruddha Roy Chowdhury directorial was a "special experience" as it allowed her to explore "many layers of emotions as an actor".

110.title: Prince Charles becomes UK King after death of Queen Elizabeth II
110.article_body: Prince Charles has become the King of UK after the death of his mother, Queen Elizabeth II. The 73-year-old had been next in line to the throne for seven decades. Meanwhile, his wife Camilla has become the Queen Consort. Queen Elizabeth II passed away aged 96 at Balmoral on Thursday.

111.title: Ranbir visits Lalbaugcha Raja with Ayan ahead of 'Brahmastra' release
111.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor and Ayan Mukerji visited Lalbaugcha Raja on Thursday to seek blessings of Lord Ganesh for their film 'Brahmastra'. On his Instagram account, Ayan shared that he is "so excited for everyone to experience" the film in theatres. Slated for September 9 release, 'Brahmastra' features Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor sharing the screen space for the first time.

112.title: PM Modi shares old pics with Queen Elizabeth II, says 'Pained by her demise'
112.article_body: Condoling the demise of Queen Elizabeth II, PM Narendra Modi tweeted, "I had memorable meetings with Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II during my UK visits in 2015 and 2018. I'll never forget her warmth and kindness." "Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II will be remembered as a stalwart...She provided inspiring leadership to her nation and people...Pained by her demise," he added.

113.title: Kapil is & will remain at the top of his game: Archana Puran Singh
113.article_body: Archana Puran Singh on Thursday shared a video, which also featured Kapil Sharma. Along with the post, Archana wrote about Kapil and said he "is and always will remain at the top of his game" because of his ability to bring humour to everything. Commenting on his latest look, Archana revealed Kapil's wife Ginni Chatrath was behind his "sartorial transformation".

114.title: What jungle raj? There is janta raj in Bihar: CM Nitish Kumar
114.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Thursday dismissed BJP's claim that 'jungle raj' (lawlessness) has returned to the state after the Mahagathbandhan government came to power. "What jungle raj? Maintaining law and order has been [our] priority...There's janta raj," he added. He stated that BJP leaders Sushil Modi and Sanjay Jaiswal may get "plum posts" in the party for criticising him.

115.title: Rajasthan Zila Parishad member arrested for taking bribe
115.article_body: A Rajasthan Zila Parishad member was arrested by the Anti-Corruption Bureau in Bikaner for taking a bribe of ₹10 lakh. The Bikaner Zila Parishad member had asked for a bribe of ₹21 lakh from a complainant to take action in a land-related matter. After the complaint was verified, a trap was laid and the accused was arrested.

116.title: Olympian Dutee Chand to join 'Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa 10' as wild card
116.article_body: Olympian Dutee Chand will be entering 'Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa 10' as a wild card. Talking about the show, Dutee said she is excited about the challenge and will "perform to the best of my capabilities". She added, "I am used to performing in front of live viewers, but this is going to be a new experience altogether."

117.title: NGT imposes ₹12,000 cr fine on Maha for environmental norms violation
117.article_body: The National Green Tribunal (NGT) on Thursday imposed a fine of ₹12,000 crore on the state of Maharashtra for allegedly not managing solid and liquid waste, causing harm to the environment. Without fixing quantified liability necessary for restoration, mere passing of orders has not shown any tangible results, the NGT said. The penalty has to be paid within two months.

118.title: Perfume trader Piyush Jain released on bail after 8 months
118.article_body: Uttar Pradesh perfume trader Piyush Jain was released on bail after 8 months in jail, officials said. Last year, his premises were raided by central agencies, and around ₹200 crore in cash and 23 kg of gold were seized. His bail plea was accepted by the Allahabad High Court, and his family members filed two sureties each of ₹10 lakh.

119.title: Corruption by a civil servant is offence against society: SC
119.article_body: Corruption by a civil servant is an offence against society and state, the Supreme Court said on Thursday. The court made the observation while hearing a Madras High Court order which dismissed a criminal complaint in a cash­-for-­job scam, citing settlement between parties. The apex court held the High Court was "completely in error in quashing the criminal complaint".

120.title: Queen Elizabeth II, Britain's longest-serving monarch, passes away aged 96
120.article_body: Queen Elizabeth II, Britain's longest-serving monarch, has passed away aged 96. On Thursday, Buckingham Palace had released a statement saying she was under medical supervision as her doctors were concerned for her health. The monarch had been facing health problems since October last year that left her with difficulties walking and standing.

121.title: Vicky's principles and values were so overwhelming: Katrina
121.article_body: Actress Katrina Kaif said husband Vicky Kaushal's "principles and values" were "overwhelming" for her. Explaining Vicky's bond with his family, Katrina said she knew he'd give the same kind of respect and importance to his wife and kids. She said with time, she understood what's important in a relationship and "what's going to take you through in the long run".

122.title: My sister-in-law was my inspiration: Tamannaah on 'Babli Bouncer'
122.article_body: Actress Tamannaah Bhatia revealed on 'The Kapil Sharma Show' that her sister-in-law was her inspiration to play her character in 'Babli Bouncer'. "Most people don't know that my bhabhi is Haryanvi. When I heard the narration of this film, I thought to myself that I had a real-life inspiration around me because she has a happy-go-lucky personality," she said.

123.title: UK's Leicester Police call for calm after India-Pak cricket match
123.article_body: Leicester Police in east England appealed for calm on Thursday, following days of unrest reportedly between Hindu and Muslim groups. The tensions spiked after an international cricket match between India and Pakistan, held last month. "Enjoy the cricket...but don't use that as an excuse...for stirring up things that frankly don't belong in our city of Leicester," Mayor Peter Soulsby said.

124.title: ITBP jawans escape with minor injuries after bus mishap in U'khand
124.article_body: Ten Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) jawans on Thursday narrowly escaped death after the bus they were travelling in fell into a gorge in Champawat district, Uttarakhand. The bus had a fall of about 15 metres and fortunately the jawans escaped with mild injuries, Champawat SP Devendra Pincha said. The bus was going from Banbasa to Pithoragarh.

125.title: I was a bit shocked: Kohli on hitting a century in a T20I to end his 1,019-day drought
125.article_body: Talking about ending his 1,019-day international hundred drought by slamming his first-ever T20I hundred, Virat Kohli said, "I was actually a bit shocked." He added, "This was the format I least expected a century to come anytime soon." "This hundred is especially dedicated to Anushka Sharma (wife) and our little daughter Vamika," Kohli further said.

126.title: Telangana Governor alleges 'humiliation' by KCR govt
126.article_body: The Governor of Telangana Tamilisai Soundararajan alleged that K Chandrashekar Rao-led TRS state government has humiliated and discriminated against the Governor's office. Addressing a gathering at the Raj Bhavan, she said that she was disheartened at not being allowed to hoist the Tricolour on Independence Day. "History will remember how a woman Governor was discriminated (against)," she added.

127.title: 62-yr-old man molests 9-yr-old girl in a lift in Guj, caught on camera
127.article_body: A 62-year-old man was arrested for allegedly molesting a nine-year-old girl in Gujarat's Ahmedabad. According to police officials, the accused molested the girl inside a lift of a residential society. The incident came to light after it was caught on a CCTV camera inside the lift. The girl narrated the incident to her family, following which a complaint was registered.

128.title: Jaffer shares 'Elo Ji Sanam Hum Aa Gaye' song, says 'Kohli to the cricket world today'
128.article_body: After Virat Kohli smashed a hundred in international cricket after 1,019 days, Wasim Jaffer took to Twitter to share a video of the song 'Elo Ji Sanam Hum Aa Gaye' from 'Andaz Apna Apna'. He wrote, "Virat Kohli to the cricket world today." Kohli slammed 122* off 61 deliveries against Afghanistan, his first-ever hundred in T20I cricket.

129.title: Germany reviews measures to curb business with China: Report
129.article_body: The German economy ministry is considering a raft of measures to make business with China less attractive as it seeks to reduce its dependency on the country, Reuters reported. The measures could include reducing or even scrapping investment and export guarantees for China. Loans from state lender KfW could reportedly be redirected to projects in other Asian countries.

130.title: India defeat Afghanistan in their last Asia Cup 2022 match, break multiple records
130.article_body: India defeated Afghanistan by 101 runs in their last Asia Cup 2022 match on Thursday. India recorded the highest-ever total (212/2) in men's T20 Asia Cup history. The match also witnessed Virat Kohli record the highest-ever individual score (122*) by an Indian in T20I cricket. Further, Bhuvneshwar Kumar, with 84 wickets, became the highest wicket-taker for India in T20I cricket.

131.title: UK PM Liz Truss unveils plan to tackle cost-of-living crisis
131.article_body: British PM Liz Truss on Thursday announced a two-year plan to address the country's cost-of-living crisis, placing a maximum annual cap of GBP 2,500 on energy bills for households from October 1. Truss said the measure would save households around £1,000 annually. "We are facing a global energy crisis and there are no 'cost-free' options," Truss said.

132.title: Akhilesh Yadav a sinking ship, SP a party of goons: UP Dy CM
132.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Deputy CM Brajesh Pathak on Thursday called Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav a "sinking ship" and called his party a "party of goons", which has been deleted from the state. "We have defeated the Samajwadi Party in 2017, 2019 and 2022," Pathak said. "Mafia and goons used to encroach over shops and houses in their government," Pathak added.

133.title: Union Cabinet approves revision of Railways’ land policy
133.article_body: The Union Cabinet has okayed the Railways Ministry's proposal to update the railways' land policy to help implement the PM Gati Shakti framework. As part of the revision, ​​​​​​​300 cargo terminals will be developed over the next five years. The framework is expected to help attract more cargo to railways and increase its modal share in freight transportation.

134.title: Palaniswami visits AIADMK headquarters in Chennai amid rousing welcome
134.article_body: AIADMK Interim General Secretary Edappadi K Palaniswami (EPS) on Thursday visited the party headquarters in Chennai for the first time after being elected to the post. He was welcomed by a huge gathering of his supporters. He said elections for the post of the party's General Secretary will be conducted soon.

135.title: Special gallery to be dedicated to workers who built new Parliament building: PM
135.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday praised workers engaged in constructing the new Parliament building and announced they will have a special gallery dedicated to them. He said the workers involved in development of Kartavya Path not only built it but also showed others a way of 'kartavya (duty)'. The Rajpath and Central Vista lawns area has been renamed 'Kartavya Path'.

136.title: Smuggler shot dead by BSF troops on Indo-Bangladesh border
136.article_body: The Border Security Force (BSF) shot dead an alleged smuggler in West Bengal's North Dinajpur district during an encounter on the Indo-Bangladesh border, officials said on Thursday. A senior BSF officer informed that the incident took place on Wednesday at 9.05 pm. A BSF personnel allegedly fired in self-defence resulting in the death of a Bangladeshi miscreant, who was armed.

137.title: Nearly 1,000 children rescued from trafficking since 2019: Jharkhand official
137.article_body: Nearly 1,000 children and youths from Jharkhand have been rescued from being trafficked since 2019, an official said. Of them, 126 children were below 10 years of age and 359 were in the age group of 11 to 14. The figures came to light during a workshop organised by Jharkhand State Child Protection Society in Hehal, Jharkhand on Thursday.

138.title: Renaming Rajpath as Kartavya Path is welcome step: Himachal Cong MLA
138.article_body: Congress MLA Vikramaditya Singh, the son of former Himachal Pradesh CM late Virbhadra Singh, on Thursday said the decision of Narendra Modi-led BJP government to rename Rajpath to 'Kartavya Path' in Delhi is a welcome step. "British rule ended. The name of Britishers on every building should be changed," Vikramaditya Singh said in a Facebook post.

139.title: Dunzo Bengaluru operations hit after delivery partners protest
139.article_body: Dunzo delivery workers in Bengaluru are protesting changes in payment structures and have stayed away from work, affecting operations in the city. The delivery workers went on strike on September 7 and 8 at Dunzo's XpressMart store in Frazer Town, leading to services being suspended. A message on the app read, "Dunzo Daily will be back in a while."

140.title: 17 injured as bus overturns in MP, passengers say driver was speeding
140.article_body: Around 17 passengers sustained injuries after a bus overturned in Jamunia Ghat in Madhya Pradesh's Raisen district on Thursday. A police official informed that the injured passengers have been hospitalised. "Passengers have said the driver was speeding and lost control of the vehicle," the official said, adding that the driver managed to run away from the scene following the incident.

141.title: Centre alone can't be responsible for managing inflation: Sitharaman
141.article_body: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has said the inflation cannot be handled only by the Centre and states, too, must play their part. RBI forms a critical part of inflation management, but fiscal policy has to work together with monetary policy in handling the inflationary surge, she said. Inflation is higher in states that haven't reduced fuel prices, she added.

142.title: Mentally unstable man trampled to death by elephants in Chhattisgarh
142.article_body: A 50-year-old mentally unstable man, identified as Bindeshwar Gond, was trampled to death by two elephants under Rajpur forest range in Chhattisgarh's Balrampur district  on Thursday, an official said. "The family of the deceased was given immediate aid of ₹25,000, while remaining compensation of ₹5.75 lakh will be given after completion of formalities," the official added.

143.title: US approves $675m in additional military aid to Ukraine
143.article_body: US President Joe Biden has sanctioned additional defence aid to Ukraine worth about $675 million, US Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin said on Thursday. He said the package includes Humvees, howitzers, artillery munitions, armoured ambulances and anti-tank systems. The US has sent aid worth several billions of dollars to Kyiv since Russia's invasion of Ukraine began in February this year.

144.title: US planning $2.8 bn military aid for nations threatened by Russia
144.article_body: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken visited Kyiv on Thursday and said Washington is planning to grant fresh military support worth over $2.8 billion to Ukraine and other European nations threatened by Russia. Blinken met President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, among other Ukrainian leaders. Blinken said the US will support Ukraine "for as long as it takes" in its war against Russia.

145.title: Anti-India slogans raised at Jammu college after Pak-Afg match
145.article_body: Anti-India slogans were allegedly raised at a college in Jammu after Pakistan beat Afghanistan in an Asia Cup 2022 match held on Wednesday. Several students staged a protest at MAM College premises earlier today against the alleged slogans. "[We've] received complaints of anti-national slogans raised in the hostel after the match...We will take strict action," the college's principal said.

146.title: Goa's Curlies beach shack set to be demolished
146.article_body: The Curlies shack in Goa will be demolished soon for allegedly flouting the coastal zone regulations. The National Green Tribunal, or NGT, upheld Goa Coastal Zone Management Authority's earlier order to demolish the shack. The green court's order comes days after BJP leader Sonali Phogat was allegedly drugged at a party in Curlies hours before her death.

147.title: ABD reveals he had a conversation with Kohli yesterday, says 'Knew something was brewing'
147.article_body: After Virat Kohli smashed his first-ever T20I hundred on Thursday, his former RCB teammate AB de Villiers revealed that he had a conversation with Kohli on Wednesday. De Villiers wrote, "When I spoke to him yesterday I knew something was brewing...Well played my friend." De Villiers also wrote, "Virat Kohli dancing again! What a lovely sight."

148.title: Bhuvneshwar Kumar breaks record for taking most wickets for India in T20I cricket
148.article_body: Team India fast bowler Bhuvneshwar Kumar on Thursday broke the record for taking most wickets for India in T20I cricket. The 32-year-old registered his career-best figures of 4-1-4-5 against Afghanistan in Asia Cup to take his tally of wickets in T20I cricket to 84. He overtook Yuzvendra Chahal, who has taken 83 wickets in T20I cricket.

149.title: Prisoner flees from hospital during treatment in Punjab's Kapurthala
149.article_body: An inmate of Kapurthala jail in Punjab ran away from the local civil hospital where he was undergoing treatment on Thursday. The inmate, a resident of a village near Phillaur, was arrested in a theft case on September 5 and later sent to judicial remand. A police official said that several teams have been formed to find him.

150.title: Kohli kisses engagement ring to celebrate his 1st hundred after 1,019 days, pics go viral
150.article_body: Former Team India captain Virat Kohli celebrated his first hundred after 1,019 days by kissing his engagement ring which he wears around his neck in a chain. Pictures and videos of his celebration have gone viral on social media. Kohli, during an interview after the innings, dedicated the hundred to his wife Anushka Sharma and their daughter Vamika.

151.title: Suryakumar Yadav breaks fridge in Afghanistan dugout with a 69-metre six, video viral
151.article_body: India batter Suryakumar Yadav smashed the first ball of his innings against Afghanistan in Asia Cup 2022 on Thursday for a 69-metre six, which went on to break a part of the fridge placed in Afghanistan's dugout. A video of the same went viral on social media. Suryakumar then got out on the very next delivery bowled by Fareed Ahmad.

152.title: Offering funeral prayers of slain militant not anti-national activity: HC
152.article_body: Offering of funeral prayers of a killed militant by the public cannot be construed to be anti-national activity of that magnitude so as to deprive them of their personal liberty, the Jammu and Kashmir and Ladakh High Court ruled. The court upheld the bail granted to few villagers and an Imam accused of offering funeral prayers of a killed militant.

153.title: Technology can never replace books: PM Narendra Modi
153.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi said that although technology is an important source of information and the internet can be used as and when required, but it cannot be an alternative to books. Speaking at the inauguration of a book fair in Ahmedabad, PM Modi said, "Books and text are basic elements of our education and worship."

154.title: Finance Ministry to begin preparing for 2023-24 Budget from Oct 10
154.article_body: The Finance Ministry will begin the exercise to prepare the annual Budget for the FY 2023-24 from October 10. The Budget will be focused on addressing critical issues of high inflation, creating demand, job creation and putting the economy on a sustained 8 per cent-plus growth path. Notably, it'll be the fifth Budget of the PM Narendra Modi-led central government.

155.title: Contestants are sensitive: Karan Johar on sugarcoating himself on 'Jhalak...'
155.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar, who is one of the judges on the dance reality show 'Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa', said he sugar-coats himself extra on the show to make his point at times. "I'm much more judgmental than I'm allowed to be," he said. "Especially when it comes to 'Jhalak...', everyone is a celebrity and thus quite sensitive and vulnerable," he added.

156.title: Mental health issues cost Indian firms $14 billion a year: Deloitte
156.article_body: A survey by Deloitte found that poor mental health amongst employees costs Indian companies $14 billion annually due to absenteeism and other reasons. About 47% of the 4,000 workers surveyed considered workplace-related stress as the biggest factor affecting their mental health, followed by financial challenges. IT sector reported the highest percentage of employees with mental health symptoms.

157.title: Virat Kohli breaks record for highest-ever score by an Indian in T20I cricket
157.article_body: Former Team India captain Virat Kohli on Thursday recorded the highest-ever score by an Indian in T20I cricket after scoring 122* off 61 deliveries against Afghanistan in Asia Cup 2022. He broke the previous record held by Rohit Sharma, who had slammed 118(43) against Sri Lanka on December 22, 2017. Kohli has now slammed 71 hundreds in international cricket.

158.title: HC misread Quran to hold hijab as non-essential practice: Petitioner in SC
158.article_body: Advocate Nizam Pasha, a counsel representing petitioners in the hijab ban case, told the SC that Karnataka HC misread the Quran's verses to hold that hijab's use wasn't an essential religious practice but a cultural one. "To say the verses have lost meaning with time is bordering on blasphemy," said Pasha. He also drew parallel between a hijab and turban.

159.title: Don't compare Sikh turbans, kirpans with hijab: SC on K'taka hijab row
159.article_body: The Supreme Court (SC) on Thursday told petitioners in the case challenging the hijab ban in Karnataka government educational institutions that comparisons with turbans worn by Sikhs are 'inappropriate'. "The SC has recognised turbans worn by Sikhs as one of...five essential components of Sikhism," Justice Hemant Gupta said. Carrying of the kirpan is recognised by the Constitution, he added.

160.title: ICC announces T20 World Cup 2022 warm-up fixtures
160.article_body: ICC today announced warm-up fixtures for the men's T20 World Cup 2022 that will begin in October in Australia. India will face hosts and reigning champions Australia in their first warm-up match on October 17 at The Gabba. India will face New Zealand two days later at the same venue. Pakistan will face England and Afghanistan in their warm-up fixtures.

161.title: Husband, wife & son try to kidnap 7-yr-old girl in UP; villagers save her
161.article_body: A seven-year-old girl was saved by villagers in UP's Belipar village after three members of a family, who worked as sanitation workers, tried to kidnap her. The three people, including a husband, wife and son, tried to lure the girl with a toffee while she was on her way to school. The kidnappers were caught after the girl started crying.

162.title: New era has begun in the form of Kartavya Path: PM Modi
162.article_body: PM Narendra Modi after inaugurating the revamped Central Vista Avenue said a new era has begun in the form of Kartavya Path. The Rajpath (formerly 'Kingsway') and Central Vista lawns area has been renamed Kartavya Path. "Symbol of colonialism, 'Kingsway', is history now and it has been erased forever," PM Modi added.

163.title: Meta, Twitter to testify in US panel on social media's impact on homeland security
163.article_body: Facebook-parent Meta, Twitter, YouTube and TikTok will testify on September 14 at the US Senate Committee on Homeland Security and Government Affairs on social media's impact on homeland security. The committee said it'll be an opportunity to understand the extent to which these firms' business models contribute to amplifying harmful content. Panel will also hear from former Facebook executives.

164.title: Security given when Yakub was buried, whose govt was it then?: Aaditya
164.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Aaditya Thackeray on Thursday refuted the BJP's claims that the former Maharashtra government under ex-CM Uddhav Thackeray was responsible for the alleged beautification of terrorist Yakub Memon's grave. "Why was Yakub Memon not dumped at sea like Osama Bin Laden? Whose government was it then? When he was buried, great security was provided," Thackeray told reporters.

165.title: Kohli smashes an international hundred after 1,019 days, records his 1st T20I century
165.article_body: Virat Kohli on Thursday smashed his first-ever T20I hundred, reaching the three-figure mark off 53 deliveries against Afghanistan in Asia Cup 2022. Kohli has hit an international hundred after 1,019 days. Kohli has now equalled former Australia captain Ricky Ponting's tally of 71 hundreds in international cricket.

166.title: Nawazuddin & Aaliya Siddiqui to team up for Teejan Bai's biopic
166.article_body: Producer Aaliya Siddiqui has roped in Nawazuddin Siddiqui to play one of the main characters in Chhattisgarh's veteran folk artiste Teejan Bai's biopic. Calling the film her "dream project", Aaliya said Nawaz has been a huge admirer of Teejan Bai's work since his theatre days. Aaliya said it will be her honour to bring Teejan Bai's story to the audience.

167.title: Some artificial sweeteners may be linked to heart diseases: Study
167.article_body: As per study, consumption of some artificial sweeteners may be associated with a greater risk of overall cardiovascular diseases. Researchers analysed artificial sweeteners in regular food products and found that aspartame present in it was linked to an increased risk of cerebrovascular events, while acesulfame potassium and sucralose were associated with a greater risk of coronary heart disease.

168.title: How did Tanishka become NEET UG 2022 topper despite 4 candidates scoring same marks?
168.article_body: Four candidates (Tanishka from Rajasthan, Vatsa Ashish Batra from Delhi, Hrishikesh Gangule and Rucha Pawashe from Karnataka) scored 715 out of 720 marks in NEET UG 2022. However, Tanishka was declared the topper due to the new tie-breaker policy which considers nine factors, including giving preference to candidate scoring higher marks/percentile in Biology, followed by Chemistry and others.

169.title: Firsts are always special: Kajol on OTT debut show 'The Good Wife'
169.article_body: Actress Kajol Devgan will be playing a lawyer in her debut web series 'The Good Wife'. Talking about it, Kajol said, "I have been playing multiple characters throughout my acting journey, but the firsts are always special." She added that OTT platforms allow creators and actors to reinvent and experiment, which is an opportunity she got with 'The Good Wife'.

170.title: JP Agarwal replaces Mukul Wasnik as MP Congress in-charge
170.article_body: Congress chief Sonia Gandhi appointed JP Agarwal as the Congress in-charge for Madhya Pradesh in place of Mukul Wasnik. Wasnik will reportedly continue as AICC general secretary but will oversee other organisational matters. "Congress president has accepted the request of Mukul Wasnik to relieve him from his responsibility as general secretary in-charge of Madhya Pradesh," a party statement said.

171.title: They didn't understand: Palash on being trolled for Atif Aslam post
171.article_body: Singer Palash Sen said people haven't understood his post on Atif Aslam. The singer, who was trolled for stating that Atif had "maximum impact on Bollywood", said he wanted to urge people to start asking bigger questions. "As Indians, we give so many opportunities to everybody, but I don't think we get the same reciprocation from other countries," he said.

172.title: Dynamic & huge: Madhavan on trailer of Vikram Vedha's Hindi remake
172.article_body: Actor R Madhavan has reacted to the trailer of the Hindi remake of 'Vikram Vedha', which stars Hrithik Roshan and Saif Ali Khan in the lead roles. Madhavan, who played Vikram in the film's original version, called the trailer "dynamic and huge". He said he "can't wait to see" the Pushkar-Gayatri directorial in theatres on September 30.

173.title: 30 students in Andhra hospitalised after complaining of suffocation
173.article_body: At least 30 students of a school in Andhra Pradesh's Kakinada district fell ill and were hospitalised on Wednesday after they complained of suffocation, according to reports. A few of the affected students reportedly also fell unconscious but all of them are now in stable condition. The students had reportedly complained of a foul smell in the classroom.

174.title: HDFC Bank raises ₹3,000 crore from bonds to fund business growth
174.article_body: Private sector lender HDFC Bank on Thursday said that it has raised ₹3,000 crore from bonds to fund business growth. The bank issued and allotted bonds to investors on a private placement basis on Thursday.
