These unsecured, subordinated, fully paid-up and non-convertible, Basel III compliant perpetual debt would carry a coupon rate of 7.84 per cent, it added.

175.title: Man hacked to death by Nihang Sikhs near Golden Temple for chewing tobacco
175.article_body: A factory worker was hacked to death by three men, including two Nihang Sikhs, over chewing tobacco on a street in Golden Temple's vicinity on Wednesday night. CCTV footage shows the three engaging in a fight with the man before he's hacked to death. One accused was arrested, and raids are being carried out to apprehend the remaining suspects.

176.title: India's fuel demand rises 16.3% in August to 17.81 million tonnes
176.article_body: India's fuel demand rose 16.3% in August as compared to the same period a year ago to 17.81 million tonnes, government data showed. Petrol sales were 11.6% higher from a year earlier at three million tonnes. Liquefied petroleum gas (LPG) sales increased 3% to 2.39 million tonnes, while naphtha sales surged 23.5% to 1.16 million tonnes.

177.title: Reliance-backed Netradyne receives $65 mn from Silicon Valley Bank
177.article_body: Reliance-backed software-as-a-service (SaaS) company Netradyne has received $65 million in debt financing from US-based Silicon Valley Bank (SVB). The Artificial Intelligence (AI) software provider was founded in 2015 by Avneesh Agrawal and David Julian. So far, Netradyne has raised $197.5 million from investors such as Reliance, Softbank, Point72, Microsoft Corp and Hyundai.

178.title: Scientists discover new solar system that could be home to alien life
178.article_body: A new planetary system with two distant planets orbiting around a small, cool star named LP 890-9 has been discovered. The planets, called LP 890-9b and LP 890-9c, take 2.7 and 8.5 days to complete one revolution around the star, respectively. The latter is also within the star's "habitable zone", making it neither too hot nor cold for alien life.

179.title: MPPSC aspirant turns into fruit chaat seller due to delayed results
179.article_body: A 28-year-old civil services aspirant has opened a fruit chaat stall with his friends in Indore due to the delayed results of Madhya Pradesh Public Service Commission (MPPSC) examinations, a report said. Tejprakash Kushwaha, who is preparing to take the 2021 Mains exams, said, "My family's financial condition isn't stable." Meanwhile, another MPPSC aspirant has started selling samosas in Indore.

180.title: Synchronised response to lower inflation is the best approach: RBI ED
180.article_body: Reserve Bank of India Executive Director (ED) Sitikantha Pattanaik on Thursday said a synchronised response to lowering inflation is the best approach. Central banks can and must deliver price stability but there's a debate on whether they alone could deliver it, Pattanaik said. India had not seen "massive" fiscal interventions to ease prices as seen recently, he added.

181.title: PM interacts with Central Vista workers, invites them to R-Day parade
181.article_body: PM Narendra Modi interacted with workers involved in the redevelopment project of Central Vista during the inauguration event of 'Kartavya Path' in Delhi on Thursday. He told them that they will be invited to the Republic Day parade, ANI reported. PM Modi also unveiled a statue of Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose at India Gate.

182.title: PM Modi inaugurates Kartavya Path, unveils Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose's statue
182.article_body: PM Narendra Modi inaugurated the revamped Central Vista Avenue in the national capital on Thursday. Centre had recently announced that the Rajpath and Central Vista lawns area will be renamed 'Kartavya Path', which will exhibit improved public spaces and facilities including lawns with walkways and refurbished canals. He also unveiled Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose's statue near India Gate.

183.title: World's earliest evidence of surgery found in 31,000-yr-old skeleton
183.article_body: A 31,000-year-old skeleton of a young adult found in Borneo in Indonesia underwent the world's first successful surgery, researchers have found. After analysing the leg bones of the skeleton, researchers confirmed that its lower left limb had been surgically amputated. Its healed bone confirmed the injury. The skeleton was found in the 40,000-year-old caves of East Kalimantan.

184.title: Devise policy for employment of transgender persons: SC tells Centre
184.article_body: The Supreme Court on Thursday directed Centre to devise a policy aimed at providing employment to transgender persons. Centre has been asked to consult with the National Council for Transgender Persons to formulate the policy. The court was hearing a plea by a transgender woman who alleged she was refused a job at Air India owing to her gender identity.

185.title: YouTube removed 13 lakh videos in India in Q2 2022, most of any country: Report
185.article_body: YouTube removed 13.24 lakh videos in India between April-June 2022, the most among 30 countries it listed in its Community Guidelines Enforcement Report Q2 2022. This is nearly thrice more than the videos YouTube removed in the US (4.45 lakh) and Indonesia (4.27 lakh). The report further stated that YouTube removed 75.43 crore comments of which, 98.9% were flagged automatically.

186.title: B2B SaaS platform Kovai.co appoints Andrew Cloke as COO
186.article_body: Enterprise software-as-a-service (SaaS) company Kovai.co has appointed Andrew Cloke as the new Chief Operating Officer. Cloke said that he would be working out of the company's UK office and "will be making regular trips to India". Founded in 2011, Kovai.co is a Coimbatore and London-based firm, and it reported an Annual Recurring Revenue (ARR) of $10 million in 2020.

187.title: Southeast B'luru will be equipped to handle rains better: Minister
187.article_body: Karnataka IT Minister CN Ashwathnarayan on Thursday assured technology companies that by next monsoon southeast Bengaluru will be better equipped to handle severe rain. Southeast Bengaluru, which is home to several technology companies, was flooded in parts after heavy rains over the weekend. Ashwathnarayan said the government will examine implementing the ‘Elcita’ model to handle heavy rains.

188.title: Summer of 2022 was the warmest ever in Europe: Climate monitor
188.article_body: This year's summer (June-August) was the warmest in Europe's recorded history, said the European Commission's climate monitor on Thursday. The Copernicus Climate Change Service said temperatures in Europe were the "highest on record for both the month of August and the summer as a whole". As per data, this August was the warmest ever recorded by a margin of 0.4°C.

189.title: 2 shot dead, 2 injured over land dispute in Punjab's Ferozepur
189.article_body: Two persons were shot dead and two others were injured over a land dispute in Punjab's Ferozepur on Thursday. The deceased were identified as 60-year-old Balwinder Singh and 22-year-old Balraj Singh. "The two parties had been feuding over the land for two years. One of the parties, armed with guns, attempted to take forceful possession of the land," police said.

190.title: Delhi's Central Vista Avenue to have parking space for 1,117 cars
190.article_body: The new-look Central Vista Avenue will have a parking facility for 1,117 cars and nearly 35 buses. It also has designated areas for app-based taxis and auto rickshaws. Also, there will be eight new amenity blocks with new signages. These will include 64 female toilets, 32 male toilets and 10 accessible toilets for the differently abled.

191.title: Take it as responsibility, not burden: Edu Minister to students on reservations
191.article_body: Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan told students questioning the quota policy to take reservations as their responsibility rather than a burden. "They (disadvantaged groups) clean our washrooms, and we call them untouchables. We've been doing it for centuries," Pradhan said. "And now that...we've provided them some assistance through affirmative action, we are questioning that?" he added.

192.title: Europe unveils hi-tech satellite to give quick extreme weather warnings
192.article_body: Europe on Wednesday unveiled the MTG-I1 satellite designed to give earlier extreme weather warnings. The satellite will be launched by the end of the year on an Ariane 5 rocket. The 3.8-tonne spacecraft will be joined in geostationary orbit by three more MTG-I imaging satellites and two MTG-S "sounding" satellites. It'll start sending images from next year onwards.

193.title: Nitish, Soren & I will come together for 2024 LS elections: Mamata
193.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Thursday said that her counterparts from Bihar and Jharkhand, Nitish Kumar and Hemant Soren, will come together to oust BJP from power in the 2024 Lok Sabha elections. "All opposition parties will join hands to defeat...BJP...The [party's] arrogance of 300 seats will be its nemesis," she said while addressing a programme in Kolkata.

194.title: Bike-taxi services banned in Indore, over 1,000 such vehicles grounded
194.article_body: Citing safety and regulatory concerns, the Indore transport department has banned the operation of bike-taxis in Madhya Pradesh's biggest city, an official said on Thursday. Over 1,000 such vehicles in the city have been grounded, he added. "After an investigation into various complaints about bike-taxis, we found their operation is not safe," Regional Transport Officer Jitendra Raghwanshi said.

195.title: Minister Rajnath Singh, Japan's Hamada review defence ties
195.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh met his Japanese counterpart Yasukazu Hamada in Tokyo on Thursday, reviewing bilateral defence cooperation and regional issues. The two ministers expressed commitment to continue multilateral military exercises including 'Malabar', 'Dharma Guardian' and 'JIMEX'. Later, Singh tweeted the meeting marked 70 years of diplomatic relations between the two countries.

196.title: India announce playing XI for match against Afghanistan; Rohit, Pandya, Chahal rested
196.article_body: Afghanistan captain Mohammad Nabi won the toss and elected to bowl first in their last Asia Cup 2022 Super 4 stage match against India. India have made three changes to playing XI, with regular captain Rohit Sharma, leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal and all-rounder Hardik Pandya being replaced by Dinesh Karthik, Axar Patel and Deepak Chahar. KL Rahul will lead India today.

197.title: European Central Bank makes its largest-ever interest rate hike of 0.75%
197.article_body: The European Central Bank (ECB) made its largest-ever interest rate increase of 0.75% on Thursday. "Over the next several meetings the Governing Council expects to raise interest rates further to dampen demand and guard against...risk of...persistent upward shift in inflation expectations," the ECB said. In July, it raised interest rates for the first time in more than 11 years.

198.title: Govt to acquire Vodafone Idea stake after share price stabilises at ₹10 or above: Report
198.article_body: The government will acquire around 33% stake in debt-ridden Vodafone Idea (Vi) after the stock price of the company stabilises at ₹10 or above, Hindustan Times reported quoting official source. The company's board has reportedly offered a stake to the government at a par value of ₹10 per share. Notably, Vi shares are trading below ₹10 since April 19, 2022.

199.title: UK cinema chain Cineworld files for bankruptcy in US
199.article_body: UK-based movie theatre chain Cineworld has filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection in Texas, United States. The company has built up $4.8 billion in net debt and said that it would keep theatres open as it seeks to restructure the debt. Cineworld operates 751 movie theatres, and anticipates exiting from Chapter 11 during the first quarter of 2023.

200.title: DCW issues summons to Delhi Police over video showing children selling liquor
200.article_body: The Delhi Commission for Women on Thursday issued summons to the city police over a video purportedly showing children selling illegal liquor and ganja. "This girl is selling the same while eating ice cream. This video was reportedly recorded in Rohini. The future of children is being ruined," DCW Chief Swati Maliwal tweeted along with the video clip.

201.title: 48-yr-old man cheats DU prof of ₹34 lakh on pretext of getting VC post
201.article_body: A 48-year-old man was arrested for allegedly cheating a Delhi University professor of ₹34 lakh promising to get him the post of Vice Chancellor at Srinagar University, police said on Wednesday. The accused had met the victim a few years back and had introduced himself as an influential person in politics, the professor said in his complaint.

202.title: Fire breaks out at makeshift office outside Dubai stadium ahead of India-Afghanistan match
202.article_body: A fire broke out at a makeshift outside the Dubai International Cricket Stadium ahead of India-Afghanistan Asia Cup 2022 Super 4 stage match on Thursday. In videos that have surfaced online, fumes can be seen from inside the stadium. The fire was later doused and there won't be any affect on the match.

203.title: Latest ODI rankings released as England become world number one team
203.article_body: The ICC on Thursday released the latest ODI team rankings, with England displacing New Zealand from the top position. England are now on top with 119 rating points, while New Zealand, who have lost two ODIs in a row against Australia, are second with 117 rating points. India are the third-ranked side with 111 rating points.

204.title: NMMC demolishes under-construction illegal structure in Navi Mumbai
204.article_body: The anti-encroachment department of the Belapur ward of Navi Mumbai Municipal Corporation (NMMC) has demolished an under-construction illegal structure in Shahbaz Gaon. As per a report, the civic body had served a notice regarding the unauthorised construction at house number 600/2. NMMC carried out the demolition drive after the construction was not removed despite the notice, the report added.

205.title: 3 students killed, 1 injured after being hit by truck in Rajasthan
205.article_body: Three students on their way to appear for B Ed examination were killed and another student was injured after they were hit by a truck on the Agra-Mumbai National Highway in Rajasthan's Dholpur, police said. The students were going to the exam centre on a motorcycle and had stopped by the roadside when the truck hit them, the SHO said.

206.title: BJP MLA injured, her relative killed as car collides with truck in MP
206.article_body: BJP MLA Leena Jain was injured and her 85-year-old relative was killed after their car collided with a truck in Vidisha district, Madhya Pradesh, on Wednesday night. Four other people also sustained injuries. The car collided with the truck while trying to save a cow on the road, police said. As per reports, the deceased was Leena Jain's mother-in-law.

207.title: Cong is trying to defame 'Brand Bengaluru' for petty gains: BJP
207.article_body: BJP leader Tejasvi Surya has criticised Congress for trying to defame "Brand Bengaluru" for their "petty gains". He added that only certain parts of Bengaluru have been flooded, but the Congress is trying to suggest that the entire city is flooded. The Karnataka unit of Congress had earlier criticised Surya for eating a dosa, while other citizens were struggling.

208.title: 35-yr-old Mumbai man held for siphoning off 1,850 iPhones worth ₹11 cr
208.article_body: A 35-year-old former employee of a Mumbai-based authorised Apple distributor, Manish Pujari, was arrested for allegedly siphoning off 1,850 iPhones worth ₹11.13 crore. Pujari surrendered after he was booked based on the complaint by Ingram Micro India Pvt Ltd. "Pujari was given the responsibility of developing relationships with the client and expanding business with them," an official said.

209.title: IT, BT firms also responsible for flood situation in B'luru: BJP leader
209.article_body: BJP leader NR Ramesh said information technology (IT) and business technology (BT) firms are also responsible for the flood situation in Bengaluru. Companies in Electronics City have encroached upon storm water drains completely or narrowed them, Ramesh said. He added that firms are threatening Karnataka government that they'll shift to Telangana. They won't survive there for a day, Ramesh said.

210.title: Indian and Chinese troops begin disengagement from Gogra-Hot Springs in Ladakh
210.article_body: Indian and Chinese troops have started withdrawing from Gogra-Hot Springs Patrolling Point-15 in Ladakh after reaching a consensus in the 16th round of military talks, the two sides said in a joint statement. This is "conducive to peace and tranquility in the border areas", the statement said. The 16th round of India-China Corps Commander level talks were held in July.

211.title: OPS has betrayed the party, he's like a chameleon: AIADMK's EPS
211.article_body: Former Tamil Nadu CM and AIADMK leader Edappadi K Palaniswami on Thursday criticised his party colleague O Panneerselvam. "He has betrayed the party. OPS is like a chameleon," EPS said. "OPS had led...violence at party HQ, how can the party cadre accept his return?" EPS said, adding elections will be held for the post of party's general secretary soon.

212.title: Allu Arjun did look trial; shoot begins by Sept 22: Pushpa 2 producer
212.article_body: 'Pushpa: The Rule' producer Y Ravi Shankar said Allu Arjun did his look trial earlier this week for the upcoming Sukumar directorial. He informed that while Arjun's look will continue to be rustic, there will be a little change as compared to his look in 'Pushpa: The Rise'. Shankar added the film's shooting will start around September 22 in Hyderabad.

213.title: BJP only party with internal democracy: JP Nadda to foreign diplomats
213.article_body: BJP chief JP Nadda on Wednesday told the foreign diplomats that BJP is the only political party in India with strong internal democracy and ideology. He added, "All posts in the party, from...president to the national president, are elected via elections within the party, and it is the only political organisation to never compromise on its ideology and principles."

214.title: PMC to charge property tax based on amenities in housing societies
214.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has reportedly decided to levy the property tax as per the facilities and price of flats in housing societies. The move would affect over 80,000 houses in the city. "The more luxurious the facility, the higher the tax," Municipal Commissioner Vikram Kumar said. This is reportedly being done only as part of a pilot study.

215.title: B'desh PM Hasina dances with local artists in Jaipur, video surfaces
215.article_body: Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina danced with the local artists, who had gathered at Jaipur Airport to welcome her to Rajasthan on Thursday. PM Hasina, who is on her four-day visit to India, visited the Ajmer Sharif Dargah today. She and her delegation reached the Jaipur International Airport by a special aircraft and were received by State Education Minister BD Kalla.

216.title: Hyderabad man given 20 yrs imprisonment for sodomising teenager
216.article_body: A 32-year-old cable TV technician in Hyderabad was sentenced to 20 years of imprisonment, by a local court, for sodomising a teenager in 2018. The man befriended the 16-year-old boy from his locality and assaulted him at his home when he was delivering some goods, the police said. The victim was sent for a medical examination and given counselling.

217.title: Video shows people carrying dead body through flood water in Maha
217.article_body: A video has emerged online showing a group of people carrying a dead body on their shoulders through flood water for cremation in Yavatmal, Maharashtra. People were seen wading through waist-deep water. This comes amid heavy rains in the region. Many areas in Maharashtra including Thane, Mumbai and Yavatmal have received a yellow alert from India Meteorological Department till Sunday.

218.title: Amit Mishra trolls Pakistani actress Sehar Shinwari over her 'cow dung' tweet
218.article_body: Veteran cricketer Amit Mishra trolled Pakistani actress Sehar Shinwari after she mocked him over his "Will eat Afghani chaap whole week if Afghanistan defeats Pakistan...Fingers crossed" tweet. "Awwww poor mishra will have to spend whole week on Cow Dung," Sehar wrote after Pakistan beat Afghanistan. Trolling Sehar, Mishra replied, "No, I have no plans of coming to Pakistan."

219.title: Doctors of Queen Elizabeth II concerned for her health, says Buckingham Palace
219.article_body: Queen Elizabeth II's doctors are "concerned" for her health and recommended she "remain under medical supervision", Buckingham Palace said on Thursday. The Queen remains comfortable and at Balmoral, the statement further said. The announcement comes a day after the 96-year-old monarch cancelled a meeting of her Privy Council.

220.title: Mumbai boy sets self ablaze as girlfriend's parents reject marriage proposal
220.article_body: A 19-year-old college student allegedly set himself on fire after his girlfriend's parents rejected his marriage proposal, police said. The boy also live-streamed the act on social media. As per reports, he was also depressed after he saw a video of his girlfriend slitting her wrist. The boy suffered 10% burns, while the girl has been administered medical treatment.

221.title: Man uses National Flag to clean scooty, arrested by Delhi Police
221.article_body: Delhi Police has arrested a man for allegedly cleaning his scooty using the National Flag. Police registered a case against the accused when a video of the incident surfaced online, in which he can be seen cleaning the dust off using the tricolour. The vehicle has been seized by the police and the flag has also been recovered.

222.title: TSRTC to provide 565 special buses for Ganesh immersion in Hyd
222.article_body: The Telangana State Road Transport Corporation (TSRTC) announced 565 special buses in Hyderabad for the Ganesh immersion ceremony on September 9. The buses will also be ferried after midnight on Friday and TSRTC information kiosks have been set up at NTR Marg, Gandhi Marg outpost and Metro control room, Basheerbagh. The buses are provided so people can reach Tank Bund.

223.title: Tesla triples China-made car sales after Shanghai plant revamp
223.article_body: Tesla sold 76,965 Chinese-made vehicles in August as against 28,217 vehicles in July after it quickened deliveries following the output revamp at its Shanghai plant. While Tesla exported 42,463 Model 3s and Model Ys from China last month, it had exported 19,756 units in July, China Passenger Car Association (CPCA) said. China's overall passenger car sales in August jumped 28.4%.

224.title: New Apple iPhone will be available in Russia, says Russian minister
224.article_body: Russian Trade and Industry Minister Denis Manturov said that Russians will be able to buy the new Apple iPhone 14. The US tech giant left Russia after the country announced a scheme authorising retailers to import products from abroad without the trademark owner's permission. After the Russian invasion of Ukraine began, Apple halted sale of its new products in Russia.

225.title: It's display of love: NC leader on 'beautification' of terrorist Yakub Memon's grave
225.article_body: National Conference leader Mustafa Kamal said 'beautification' of 1993 Mumbai bombings convict Yakub Memon's grave is a "display of love". "[The beautification] neither weakens religion, nor is it wrong...Those who were pained will give themselves to this grave," Kamal said. "It isn't wrong for us to remember those who worked for us, helped us, took care of us," he added.

226.title: UK PM Liz Truss caps consumer energy bills for 2 years at £2,500/year
226.article_body: British Prime Minister Liz Truss capped consumer power bills for two years at £2,500 a year on Thursday. However, Truss did not put a price on the package. Deutsche Bank estimated that the energy price offset along with Truss' promised tax cuts could cost £179 billion. Energy prices were soaring in UK due to the Russia-Ukraine war and COVID-19 aftershocks.

227.title: Need restrictive monetary policies for some time: US Fed Vice Chair
227.article_body: US Federal Reserve Vice Chair Lael Brainard said monetary policies need to be restrictive for "some time" for the inflation to move down towards the target. She said the policy rate will need to rise further. The time for the inflation to back down to 2% will depend on continued easing in supply constraints and slower demand growth, Brainard added.

228.title: Garba a medium of 'love jihad', people must bring their IDs: MP Minister
228.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Culture Minister Usha Thakur has said that the Garba pandals, usually organised during Navratri, have become a medium of 'love jihad'. "Anyone who comes to the Garba should bring their identity card. No one can enter the Garba without identification. This is also advice and an admonition for all," she said.

229.title: Incident like Sonali Phogat's death shouldn't be linked to tourism: Goa minister
229.article_body: The incident like BJP leader Sonali Phogat's death should not be linked to the tourism industry and its prospects, Goa Tourism Minister Rohan Khaunte said on Thursday. "The police department is investigating Phogat's death. Let the investigation reveal the truth behind her death," he added. Meanwhile, Goa CM Pramod Sawant said the probe into the matter is on right track.

230.title: Karza Technologies Co-founder buys ₹70 cr home in Mumbai: Report
230.article_body:
Co-founder of Karza Technologies, Gaurav Samdaria, has bought a ₹70 crore sea-facing duplex in Mumbai's tony Worli Sea Face, as per a report. The apartment is in the Legacy building on Khan Abdul Gaffar Khan Road and was sold by Sachiv Sahni to the startup Co-founder. Earlier in March, 
Bengaluru-based Perfios Software Solutions bought Karza Technologies for around ₹600 crore.

231.title: US approves potential sale of F-16 equipment to Pak in $450-million deal
231.article_body: The US State Department has approved the potential sale of F-16 aircraft sustainment and related equipment to Pakistan in a deal valued at up to $450 million. This is the first major security assistance to Pakistan after Donald Trump in 2018 stopped all defence and security assistance to Pakistan alleging that Islamabad wasn't a partner in its fight against terrorism.

232.title: Investigation is on right track: Goa CM on Sonali Phogat death case
232.article_body: Goa CM Pramod Sawant on Wednesday said that he has full faith in the state police department that is investigating BJP leader Sonali Phogat’s death case. "The investigation...is on the right track," CM Sawant added. "At present, I don’t want to discuss any investigation about this case," he stated.

233.title: PM's harebrained schemes have weakened us: Asaduddin Owaisi
233.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi criticised Prime Minister Narendra Modi for his defence policies and said that India is running short of weapons in its fight against neighbouring country China. "PM's harebrained schemes have weakened us. India's biggest challenge is China...We're going to be short of HUNDREDS of jets. Too bad WEAK PM Modi can't blame Mughals for it," he tweeted.

234.title: Greenpeace ranks Toyota lowest in study on decarbonisation efforts
234.article_body: Greenpeace has ranked Japanese automakers Toyota, Honda, and Nissan at the bottom in a study on automakers' decarbonisation efforts. Greenpeace ranked Toyota last out of 10 automakers, highlighting that zero-emission vehicles made up less than 1% of company's sales. Last week, Toyota said it would invest up to $5.1 billion in Japan and the US to make electric vehicle batteries.

235.title: Powerplay raises $7.14 mn in Series A led by Accel, Sequoia Surge
235.article_body: Construction management platform Powerplay has raised $7.14 million in its Series A funding round led by Accel and Sequoia Surge. India Quotient, and Snapdeal founders Kunal Bahl and Rohit Bansal also participated in the round. Powerplay was founded by Iesh Dixit and Shubham Goyal in 2020, and claims 3 times growth in its operating system (OS) business compared to 2021.

236.title: Congress & Rahul have done work of breaking country: Union Minister
236.article_body: The Congress and Rahul Gandhi have done the work of breaking the country, Union Minister Kiren Rijiju said on Thursday. "You listen to Rahul Gandhi, he only talks about disintegrating every state on the basis of language, religion and many more," Rijiju added. On Wednesday, Rijiju had tweeted, "His (Rahul) party assaulted every institution of India including judiciary."

237.title: Delhi HC waives off cost of ₹25,000 imposed on ex-CBI chief Nageswara Rao
237.article_body: Delhi High Court has waived off the cost of ₹25,000 imposed on M Nageswara Rao, the former CBI chief and retired IPS officer. The High Court had imposed the cost while dismissing his plea over a Twitter verified tag. Earlier, the petition stated that the verification tag from the Twitter account was removed on March 16, 2022.

238.title: River, dry for 30 years, floods Bengaluru following weekend rains
238.article_body: The Dakshina Pinakini River, which was dry for 30 years, overflowed and flooded parts of Bengaluru on Wednesday following heavy rains over the weekend. The Channasandra Main Road was flooded under 4 feet water after the river overflowed. The Channasandra Main Road, which starts from Hope Farm Junction to Koralur and joins Hoskote to Malur, witnessed severe traffic congestion.

239.title: Canara Bank increases lending rate by up to 0.15%, EMIs to go up
239.article_body: Canara Bank increased its marginal cost of funds-based lending rate (MCLR) by up to 0.15% or 15 basis points across all tenors. The revised rates have come into effect from September 7. With the increase, EMIs for housing, vehicles and personal loans will go up for those borrowers who availed of loans on MCLR. One-year MCLR will now be 7.75%.

240.title: Security guard electrocuted to death in flooded basement in B'luru
240.article_body: A security guard died after he was electrocuted in a flooded basement in Bengaluru. The incident occurred when the deceased was trying to start a generator in the basement of Hulkul Ascent apartment. The victim's elder brother has filed a complaint, stating the basement was completely filled with water and held the building owner and employer responsible for the death.

241.title: Benzema sidelined for a month after injury during Madrid's win over Celtic
241.article_body: Real Madrid striker Karim Benzema is reportedly set to be sidelined for a month due to injuries he sustained during Real Madrid's Champions League win against Celtic. Benzema was substituted after 30 minutes during the match, which Madrid won 3-0. As per Real Madrid's medical report, Benzema injured the semitendinosus tendon and strained the quadriceps muscle in his right thigh.

242.title: Google pilot to allow daily fantasy sports, rummy games on Play Store in India
242.article_body: As part of a pilot project being undertaken by Google, daily fantasy sports and rummy games apps will be available on Play Store in India starting September 28. Applicants that are accepted to participate in the pilot will be eligible to distribute their apps to users in India, Google said. Apps failing to meet guidelines will be removed, it added.

243.title: Am I their bonded labour?: Mamata on being called for Netaji statue inauguration
243.article_body: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Thursday criticised central government saying that she feels bad that they're now making a Netaji statue in Delhi. "What about the statue present before? I received letter from an under secretary stating PM will inaugurate the statue today and you be there before the event commences. Am I their bonded labour?" she said.

244.title: Singtel entities offload 1.76% stake in Bharti Airtel: Report
244.article_body: Singapore Telecommunications (Singtel) entities have offloaded a 1.76% stake in Bharti Airtel for ₹7,128 crore, sources said. Bharti Airtel promoter Bharti Telecom has bought a 1.63% stake from Pastel for ₹6,602 crore through an open market transaction. Viridian also reportedly offloaded about 1 crore shares. Following this, public shareholding in Bharti Airtel will rise to 44.87% from 44.74%.

245.title: I respect PM Modi for courage to buy discounted Russian oil amid global pressure: FM
245.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman praised PM Narendra Modi for his courage to permit the purchase of discounted Russian oil amid global pressure. She added, "India's entire import had 2% of the Russian component, and it was ramped up to 12-13% within a couple of months." I give credit to his statesmanship for keeping ties with other countries intact, she said.

246.title: Automobile retail sales in India surge by 8.31% in August: FADA
246.article_body: Retail sales of automobiles in India surged by 8.31% to 15,21,490 units in August 2022 as against 14,04,704 units in August 2021, the Federation of Automobile Dealers Associations (FADA) said on Thursday. This was driven by an increase in registrations of vehicles across all major segments. Retail sales of two-wheelers also grew by 8.52% to 10,74,266 units this August.

247.title: Decomposed bodies of Bengal couple in 20s found in Chennai lodge
247.article_body: Decomposed bodies of a couple from West Bengal were found in a lodge in Chennai on Wednesday, said police. The victims, 24-year-old Prasenjit Gosh and 20-year-old Arpita Pal, had booked a room on Saturday. Police were called in after a lodge staffer noticed a foul smell coming from the locked room. The couple were found dead on the bed.

248.title: B'luru hotels offer rooms at discounted prices for flood affected
248.article_body: Bengaluru hotels on Wednesday said that they will offer rooms at discounted prices for people whose homes have been affected by heavy rains in the last few days. The Bruhath Bangalore Hotels Association (BBHA) made the offer after reports emerged stating that hotels were exploiting the situation by hiking the prices of the rooms.

249.title: Fallen soldier's family refuses to accept Shaurya Chakra sent by courier
249.article_body: A fallen soldier's family has refused to accept the Shaurya Chakra which arrived at their home in Gujarat by courier. "It must be conferred by the President," Lance Naik Gopal Singh Bhadoriya's father said. The award was approved in 2018. However, it was delayed amid a dispute between Gopal's estranged wife and his parents over who would receive the award.

250.title: Cricket betting racket busted in Hyd, materials worth ₹20 lakh seized
250.article_body: The Rachakonda Special Operations Team along with the Saroornagar Police raided a gaming house in Hyderabad and busted a cricket betting racket on Wednesday and arrested two persons. The officials also seized material worth ₹20.5 lakh, including cash and mobile phones. The accused were identified as T Ashok, a bookie from Saroornagar, and M Kishore, a bookie from Yacharam.

251.title: BMC fills 2,000 potholes in 10 days for smooth Ganpati Visarjan
251.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has fixed 2,000 potholes in the last 10 days, 200 on average each day, to ensure smooth and hassle-free Ganpati Visarjan processions in Mumbai. The areas with the most potholes reportedly were Andheri, Ghatkopar, Jogeshwari, Goregaon and Malad. The Ganesh mandals have praised BMC for their quick road repairs.

252.title: Schneider Electric Infra shares surge 14% to hit 52-week high
252.article_body: Schneider Electric Infrastructure's shares surged by 14% on Thursday to hit a new 52-week high of ₹167.85 on the NSE after the company's board gave a nod to setting up a manufacturing unit in Kolkata. In the first quarter of FY23, it reported a profit of ₹26.5 crore against a loss of ₹16.08 crore in the corresponding period last year.

253.title: Pics show 'beautified' grave of terrorist Yakub Memon with LED lighting; probe ordered
253.article_body: The Mumbai Police removed the LED lights around terrorist Yakub Memon's grave at Bada Kabarastan on Thursday. The action was taken after videos and pictures of Memon's grave that was 'beautified' with marble tiles, halogen and LED lights were circulated on social media, police said. The Maharashtra government has also asked Mumbai Police to conduct a detailed probe.

254.title: UP woman gets obscene messages as husband shares her number with 30 friends
254.article_body: In a bid to take revenge on his wife for filing dowry harassment case against him, a man in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur reportedly shared her WhatsApp number with his 30 friends. The accused allegedly asked them to send obscene texts, photos and videos to his wife. The woman alleged her husband did this to pressurise her to withdraw the case.

255.title: 8,000 police personnel to be deployed for Ganesh Visarjan in Pune
255.article_body: About 8,000 police personnel would reportedly be deployed across Pune to ensure the smooth conduct of immersion of the idols of Lord Ganesha for the Ganpati Visarjan on Friday. The deployment will be headed by Police Commissioner Amitabh Gupta. Officials said the entire staff of the traffic control branch would be on the roads to man the traffic and processions.

256.title: 7 passengers held at Hyd airport, cigarettes worth ₹11 lakh seized
256.article_body: Customs officials at Hyderabad airport arrested seven passengers for allegedly trying to smuggle cigarettes and 100 e-cigarettes worth ₹11 lakh. On suspicion, the officials checked the baggage of passengers travelling to India from Bahrain and Dubai and found they were carrying the cigarettes illegally. "The goods have been confiscated," Hyderabad Customs tweeted.

257.title: CJI-led SC bench to hear pleas challenging CAA on September 12
257.article_body: The Supreme Court is set to hear petitions challenging the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) on September 12. A bench of Chief Justice of India UU Lalit and Justice S Ravindra Bhat will hear the matter. The Kerala government, TMC MP Mahua Moitra, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi and Congress' Jairam Ramesh are among those who have challenged the Act.

258.title: 45-yr-old Thane man gets life imprisonment for raping minor relative
258.article_body: A special court in Thane has sentenced a 45-year-old man to life imprisonment for raping his brother-in-law's minor daughter. The court also imposed a fine of ₹10,000 on the accused. The accused raped the minor multiple times between July 2016 and December 2017 when the 16-year-old victim lived with her grandmother in Thane, special public prosecutor told the court.

259.title: Request parties to unite to bring Netaji's remains to India: Bose's daughter
259.article_body: Freedom fighter Subhas Chandra Bose's daughter urged political parties in the country to work together for bringing Netaji's remains to India. "It was my father's ambition to experience a free India. Tragically, his untimely death denied him this wish. I feel his remains should at least touch the soil of India and bring closure to the matter," she said.

260.title: Demolition of Pune's Chandani chowk old bridge to begin on Sept 9
260.article_body: The demolition of the old bridge at Pune's Chandani chowk will begin on September 9, National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) Pune project head Sanjay Kadam said. "Initially...planning and drilling part will be carried out by the team with the support of the NHAI and district administration," he added. A traffic block of 'nine to 10 hours' will be implemented.

261.title: Marvel film would be so fun: Kim Kardashian on whether she'd act
261.article_body: Kim Kardashian expressed that she would love to act if she is offered something like a Marvel film. "Would I act? I would if something fun came about. Maybe a Marvel movie, that would be so fun to do," she said. However, she mentioned that she is not actively looking for an acting project.

262.title: Centre didn't invite me to be part of Sheikh Hasina's visit to India: Mamata
262.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Thursday said that the Centre did not invite her to be a part of Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina's visit to India. "I share a very good relationship with…Sheikh Hasina…This is the first time the PM of Bangladesh came to India and did not come to Bengal despite her desire to meet me," Banerjee added.

263.title: Boycott calls are more aggressive for 'Brahmastra': Taran Adarsh
263.article_body: Film trade analyst Taran Adarsh said boycott calls against Ranbir Kapoor-starrer 'Brahmastra' are "more aggressive". "But I've always maintained...be it IPL, weather conditions, examination or boycott calls, nothing can harm a film if the content is strong," he added. Speaking about 'Laal Singh Chaddha', Taran said the 'boycott' trend became "sharper" as the film's content was weak.

264.title: This one will hurt for a while: Sinner after losing to Alcaraz in US Open
264.article_body: Italian tennis player Jannik Sinner said his defeat against Carlos Alcaraz in the US Open quarter-finals "will hurt for a while". "I had some tough losses...[but] this is in the top list...it was a good match for sure. But a very, very tough one," he added. Alcaraz defeated Sinner with a scoreline of 6-3, 6-7(7-9), 6-7(0-7), 7-5, 6-3.

265.title: No FTA with Israel until pact is mutually beneficial: Goyal
265.article_body: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal said that India will not ink a free trade agreement (FTA) with Israel until it gets a good deal, adding that the pact has to be "reciprocally beneficial". With a bilateral annual trade of nearly $8 billion, India and Israel have been engaged in FTA negotiations since May 2010, however, haven't been successful yet.

266.title: 'Didn't get the job?' UK job search company in ad featuring Sunak as he loses UK PM race
266.article_body: After Liz Truss defeated Rishi Sunak in the race to become the next UK PM, a UK job search company mocked Sunak with an advertisement. It showed his picture alongside text that said, "Didn't get the job? We've got jobs for everyone. Find one that works for you." "Ouch!! The British humour remains as savage as ever!" a person tweeted.

267.title: Actor Ajay Devgn shares his 1st look as Chitragupt from 'Thank God'
267.article_body: Actor Ajay Devgn took to Instagram and shared his first look from 'Thank God'. Along with the look, Ajay wrote, "This Diwali, Chitragupt is coming to play the game of life with you and your family!" Rakul Preet Singh and Sidharth Malhotra will also feature in the film. The film, directed by Indra Kumar, will release on October 25.

268.title: SBI misreads Kannada numeral written on cheque, dishonours it; fined ₹85,177
268.article_body: A State Bank of India branch in Karnataka's Haliyal has been fined ₹85,177 by the Consumer Forum for dishonouring a cheque after failing to recognise a Kannada numeral written on it. Vadirajacharya Inamdar had issued a cheque for ₹6,000 towards his electricity bill on September 3, 2020. The branch had wrongly identified the Kannada numeral nine (for September) as six.

269.title: Highway construction can be done in a way to aid building new lakes: Gadkari
269.article_body: Road Transport and Highways Minister Nitin Gadkari on Thursday said his Ministry can help address the water woes in India. Highway construction requires soil, which can be obtained in a manner that new water bodies can be formed, Gadkari said. "There's no dearth of water but water management (is an issue). We can use highways for building lakes," he added.

270.title: Rules must be followed: Mumbai Traffic Police to conduct seatbelt awareness drive
270.article_body: Calling the car accident of businessman Cyrus Mistry "an eye opener", Mumbai Traffic Police said it will conduct an awareness drive to spread the importance of wearing front and rear seat belts in vehicles. "Rules must be followed. It's compulsory for...drivers to ask the passengers to wear their seat belts. If not found, we'll penalise...taxi drivers," a police official said.

271.title: IIM dropout among 7 held by Delhi Police for smuggling drugs via dark net
271.article_body: The Delhi Police Crime Branch has arrested seven people, including an IIM dropout and a fashion designer, for allegedly smuggling drugs with the help of the dark net, police said on Thursday. In three different operations, the police seized over 28 blotting papers of LSD, 12.6 gram of MDMA, 84 gram of curated marijuana and 220 gram of hashish.

272.title: DMRC to provide electric bus services for Central Vista visitors
272.article_body: Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) will provide electric bus services to people wanting to visit India Gate and the new Central Vista Avenue from Friday onwards, officials said. The visitors would be able to board these buses from Bhairon Road from 5 pm-9 pm. DMRC said this facility will be available initially for a week and may be extended further.

273.title: Bengaluru's Bellandur road is now safe to travel for commuters: Police
273.article_body: The Bengaluru Traffic Police today said that it is safe for commuters to travel through Bellandur as waterflow has come down in the area. Bellandur was reportedly one of the most affected areas due to severe waterlogging. Earlier many vehicles were stuck on this stretch of Bengaluru and police urged people to avoid travelling on Outer Ring Road (ORR).

274.title: Draft data anonymisation rules taken down from IT Ministry's website
274.article_body: The Guidelines for Anonymisation of Data were taken down from the IT Ministry's website on Tuesday, about one week after they were put up for public feedback. They were reportedly taken down to send them for ministerial evaluation. Anonymisation refers to the removal or modification of data, such as Aadhaar numbers, so that individuals can't be identified from it.

275.title: Woman fights phone snatcher in Delhi; incident caught on camera
275.article_body: A woman fought off a phone snatcher while going to visit her friend in Delhi's Badarpur area, police said. The incident was caught on CCTV camera wherein the man can be seen hitting her as she grabs onto his t-shirt. The woman had caught the thief by his shirt but he ran away after the phone fell down, police added.

276.title: Man cracks 'bomb in bag' joke at Indore airport; quizzed, searched
276.article_body: A family of three had to undergo intense questioning after a man, while undergoing a security check at Indore's Devi Ahilya Bai Holkar Airport, joked about a bomb in his bag. The man apologised for his behaviour during questioning, said Airport Director CV Ravindran, adding that the family missed their flight because of the incident.

277.title: Man arrested for harassing lions, chasing them on bike in Gujarat
277.article_body: A 25-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly harassing Asiatic lions in Gujarat's Gir forest by chasing them on his bike. The accused, Devku Mobh from Amreli district, posted a video on social media which showed him harassing lions and other wild animals, said police. Officials have seized a bike and a mobile phone from the man.

278.title: We did talk about another 'Forrest Gump': Tom Hanks
278.article_body: Actor Tom Hanks revealed that the makers of 'Forrest Gump' had thought of a sequel. However, the conversation lasted only for 40 minutes and the idea never took off. Hanks said he did a "smart thing" to not sign a contract that had a contractual obligation to a sequel. He said there should be a reason to do a sequel.

279.title: Delhi man fires shots during b'day party, arrested as video goes viral
279.article_body: Delhi Police have arrested a man and his two friends for firing in the air during a birthday party in the Shastri Park area. The arrest took place after a video of the celebratory firing went viral on social media, showing the accused pulling out a pistol and firing in the air. The weapon used in firing was reportedly illegal.

280.title: Conversation with friend helped: Big B on how he dealt with father's death
280.article_body: Amitabh Bachchan remembered a friend's conversation that helped him cope with his father Harivansh Rai Bachchan's death. He recalled that when he was upset, his friend asked him to be happy about spending over 60 years with his father. "He then said that he was able to spend only 25. This helped me realise the importance of elders," he said.

281.title: Will slow down when my body tells me naturally: Bhumi Pednekar
281.article_body: Speaking about her hectic schedule, actress Bhumi Pednekar has said that she has not got much of her "me-time" this year. "I feel me-time is...important...It's...revenge work that I'm doing for the time that we lost in COVID-19," she added. Bhumi stated, "When naturally my body will tell me...I'll only then slow down. But at the moment...I'm having a blast."

282.title: Pant might be dropped: Uthappa on India's likely XI against Afghanistan
282.article_body: Talking about possible changes in India's playing XI against Afghanistan in their Asia Cup match today, Robin Uthappa said Dinesh Karthik might be included in the XI. "I feel Rishabh Pant might be dropped and Deepak Hooda will bat at number five," he stated. "In bowling, I think Deepak Chahar will play," added Uthappa.

283.title: Kids made to clean toilet in UP school, probe on after video surfaces
283.article_body: A purported video showing students of a primary school in the Sohaon area of UP's Ballia being forced to clean a toilet has surfaced on social media. A man reportedly scolded the children and threatened to lock the toilet if they did not obey. Basic Education Officer Maniram Singh said that a probe has been ordered into the incident.

284.title: More BJP talks about 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', it's evident they're rattled: Jairam
284.article_body: Congress' Jairam Ramesh said the more BJP talks about 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', the more it is evident that the party is "rattled". "I'm 100% sure 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' is 'sanjivani' for Congress, it is a lifesaver...it will renew the party," Ramesh added. "Cong after 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' will be the party that cannot be taken for granted," he stated.

285.title: France drops probe into its troops' complicity during 1994 Rwandan genocide
285.article_body: French judges have dropped a case against French peacekeepers who were accused of being complicit during 1994 Rwanda genocide. In a statement, French Public Prosecutor's office said they found nothing that would indicate French military forces' direct participation in abuses committed in refugee camps. Genocide survivors accused French soldiers of deliberately abandoning them to Hutus extremists.

286.title: Ukraine's top general warns of threat of Russia using nuclear weapons
286.article_body: Valeriy Zaluzhnyi, Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, warned of the threat of Russia using nuclear weapons in Ukraine. In an article, co-authored by lawmaker Mykhailo Zabrodskyi, Zaluzhnyi said it is impossible to rule out direct involvement of the world's leading countries in a "limited" nuclear conflict. Russia has denied the use of nuclear or chemical weapons in Ukraine.

287.title: 19-yr-old girl from Chennai dies by suicide after failing NEET-UG exam
287.article_body: A 19-year-old Chennai student allegedly died by suicide after she failed to clear the National Eligibility Entrance Test (NEET-UG). She is a second-year medical student in the Philippines and took the NEET to study in India. "After the exam got over in July, we've been providing mental health counselling to students through 210 counsellors," Tamil Nadu minister Ma Subramanian said.

288.title: Kejriwal govt imposing ban on crackers in Delhi to appease Muslims: BJP
288.article_body: BJP has accused AAP of "hurting Hindu sentiments" by banning firecrackers in Delhi ahead of Diwali and Dussehra festivals. "This decision has been taken to appease Muslims in Gujarat. This is not an issue related to pollution. It is an attempt to stop Hindu festivals," BJP leader Kapil Mishra said. "People will not obey such an unscientific order," he added.

289.title: Video shows primary students cleaning school toilet in UP, probe ordered
289.article_body: Ballia's Basic Education Officer Maniram Singh on Thursday said that he has ordered a probe after a clip purportedly showing students being forced to clean toilets at a district primary school surfaced on social media. In the video, a man can be seen scolding the students and threatening to lock the toilet if the students don't do as asked.

290.title: Old pic shows former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry having meal at dhaba with his driver
290.article_body: An old photo showing former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry, who died in a car crash on Sunday, having a meal at a dhaba with his driver has resurfaced. The photo shows Mistry having the meal in a traditional setting while sitting on a cot. The picture was reportedly taken during a road trip, according to a Facebook post.

291.title: Steve Jobs' wife, Tim Cook launch online archive dedicated to him
291.article_body: Apple Co-founder Steve Jobs' wife Laurene Powell Jobs, Apple CEO Tim Cook, and former design chief Jony Ive came together at the CodeCon 2022 to launch an online archive dedicated to Jobs. The online archive features historical materials related to Jobs, including content never seen by the public until now. It also shares some notable quotes from Jobs.

292.title: Lido files for bankruptcy, 6 months after asking 1,200 employees to resign
292.article_body: Ronnie Screwvala-backed edtech startup Lido Learning has filed for insolvency and bankruptcy. This comes almost six months after reports of the company shutting its operations and asking about 1,200 employees to resign amid a cash crunch. According to the company's filings, Lido failed to pay off its debts payable to its former employees, customers, vendors, lenders and other creditors.

293.title: Deepika, Kriti, Shraddha among frontrunners for 'Aashiqui 3': Report
293.article_body: Actresses Deepika Padukone, Kriti Sanon and Shraddha Kapoor are reportedly frontrunners for playing the female lead in Anurag Basu's 'Aashiqui 3' alongside actor Kartik Aaryan. "As we speak, the team is in the process of locking the cast...also giving those final touches to the script," a source close to the development told Pinkvilla. Shraddha had featured in 'Aashiqui 2'.

294.title: Fast local trains to halt at all stations between Mumbai Central, Churchgate tomorrow
294.article_body: The Western Railway announced that all fast local trains, which run from 5 pm to 8.30 pm towards Churchgate, will be provided halts at all stations between Mumbai Central and Churchgate on Friday due to Ganpati Visarjan. Additionally, Western Railway has also decided to run eight Ganpati special locals during midnight of September 9-10 between Churchgate and Virar stations.

295.title: Businessman Atulya Mafatlal passes away in Mumbai aged 60
295.article_body: Businessman Atulya Mafatlal reportedly died in his sleep early on Wednesday morning at Mafatlal House in Mumbai's Altamount Road, aged 60. He'd woken up at around 4 am feeling uneasy but eventually went back to sleep, his friend informed. When he didn't wake up in the morning, he was taken to Breach Candy Hospital, where doctors declared him brought dead.

296.title: Will you consider Shami, Chahar & where does Karthik stand: Jaffer
296.article_body: With India crashing out of the race for Asia Cup 2022 final, ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said Team India has the quality but they're not playing with the right combination. "T20 WC squad will soon be announced, and with what combination you will play. Will you consider Mohammad Shami, Deepak Chahar, and where does Dinesh Karthik stand?" asked Jaffer.

297.title: 25-yr-old man arrested for stealing gym equipment in Chandigarh
297.article_body: A 25-year-old man was arrested for allegedly stealing weight plates and other gym equipment from a vacant plot in Chandigarh. According to the complainant, the theft took place on the intervening night of September 4 and 5. The accused was arrested while he was going to sell the gym plates to a scrap dealer in an auto, police said.

298.title: PM Modi is a great guy, his job is not easy: Donald Trump
298.article_body: In an interview with NDTV, former US President Donald Trump praised Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi and said, "It is not an easy job he (PM Modi) has got." "I've had a great relationship with India and with Prime Minister Modi. We've been friends. And I think he's a great guy and doing a terrific job," he added.

299.title: Kapiva releases user stories of losing over 10 kgs with Get Slim Juice
299.article_body: In videos shared by Kapiva, Kavitha shared she lost 13 kgs, while Tritoy said he lost 24 kgs he gained after spondylitis, and Akanksha shared she lost 13 kgs in 6 months. Kapiva reported that Get Slim Juice, with 12 Ayurvedic herbs, was deemed effective by 90% of users. Kapiva also provides free diet and yoga plans with doctor consultation.

300.title: Buy your mom an iPhone: Tim Cook to user who complained about iOS-Android texting
300.article_body: Responding to an audience member at a conference, who said he couldn’t send his mother videos on her Android phone because of restrictions on iPhone SMS messaging, Apple CEO Tim Cook said, "Buy your mom an iPhone." Cook added, Apple doesn't spend a lot of effort improving the iPhone-Android texting experience as its users haven't asked for it.

301.title: It's a pleasure working with Gerard Butler, we're very similar: Elnaaz
301.article_body: Speaking about working with actor Gerard Butler in the Hollywood film 'Kandahar', actress Elnaaz Norouzi has said that he is a "fantastic" human being. "It's a great pleasure working with him...He's super fun and we're very similar, we're both crazy," Elnaaz added. "Being a part of such a big movie which has Gerard makes me feel really good," she stated.

302.title: Russia interrogated, detained, forcibly deported many Ukrainians: US
302.article_body: The US said it has found evidence that Moscow interrogated, detained and forcibly deported hundreds of thousands of Ukrainians to Russia. During a Security Council meeting called by the US and Albania, it was highlighted that Russia's "filtration operations" included data collection, strip searches and torture. Russia dismissed allegations as "fantasy" and disinformation campaign.

303.title: NASA selects Axiom Space to make spacesuit for 2025 Moon walk
303.article_body: NASA has selected Axiom Space to deliver a moonwalking system including advanced spacesuits for the Artemis III Moon mission in 2025. The task order has a base value of $228.5 million. Artemis III will be the first mission of NASA's new Artemis program to land astronauts on the Moon, including the first woman and the first person of colour.

304.title: 19-yr-old Alcaraz beats Sinner in 2nd-longest match in US Open history, enters semis
304.article_body: Spain's 19-year-old Carlos Alcaraz has entered the semi-finals at the US Open after defeating Italian Jannik Sinner. Alcaraz won with a scoreline of 6-3, 6-7(7-9), 6-7(0-7), 7-5, 6-3 in the quarter-final that lasted five-hour and 15 minutes, the second-longest match in the tournament's history. "It was really difficult to close out the match. I tried to stay calm," said Alcaraz.

305.title: Bandh in 10 Odisha districts, groups demand separate Koshal state
305.article_body: Two organisations - Koshal Raej Mukti Morcha and Koshal Sena - observed a 12-hour bandh in about 10 districts of Odisha on Wednesday, demanding for a separate state of Koshal. The groups claimed that the western part of the state has been neglected by the government. Offices, courts, educational institutions, shops and markets remained closed in several districts.

306.title: Mercedes to send ECM of car in Mistry's accident to Germany for analysis: Official
306.article_body: Mercedes-Benz India is sending the Electronic Control Module (ECM) of the car in which former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry was killed, to Germany for analysis, said an official. The ECM's analysis can help identify technical issues like brake failure or low brake fluid. In a statement, Mercedes-Benz India said it is cooperating with the authorities investigating the car crash.

307.title: Afghanistan's behaviour not acceptable, even India players are kissing, hugging us: Akhtar
307.article_body: Ex-Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar criticised Afghanistan cricketers' behaviour in their Asia Cup 2022 Super 4 stage match against Pakistan. Akhtar alleged Afghanistan players misbehaved with Asif Ali after dismissing him. "Afghanistan's behaviour isn't acceptable. Even, Team India players are kissing and hugging us. Despite being our brothers, Afghanistan players are misbehaving with us," he stated.

308.title: Artist collapses, dies of heart attack on stage in Jammu; video surfaces
308.article_body: An artist died of heart attack after collapsing on stage during a performance at an event in Jammu, officials have said. A video, which has surfaced on social media, shows the artist dancing before collapsing. Many in the audience thought it was part of the dance performance, reports quoting sources said.

309.title: Many metro barricades removed in Mumbai for Ganesh Visarjan tomorrow
309.article_body: The Mumbai Metropolitan Region Development Authority (MMRDA) removed metro barricades from major locations ahead of Ganpati visarjan on Friday. Metro barricades were removed at Santoshi Mata Mandir, following a request from Lalbaugcha Raja Ganesh Mandal. "On Western Express Highway near green naala, out of 270 metres of barricading, 120 metres have been removed," MMRDA's SVR Srinivas said.

310.title: Hong Kong journalists union's Chairman arrested over disorderly conduct
310.article_body: Ronson Chan, Chairman of the Hong Kong Journalists Association (HKJA) has been arrested over accusations of disorderly conduct and obstruction of a police official. According to Chan's employer, Channel C, Chan was reporting when he allegedly refused to show his ID to police officers who said he was "acting suspiciously". Chan had earlier worked with online news platform StandNews.

311.title: I became unwell: Nargis Fakhri on her absence from Bollywood
311.article_body: Actress Nargis Fakhri, speaking about her absence from the industry, said she became unwell. "I was going through too much mental and physical stress. I had a lot of physical ailments that were interfering with my daily life," Nargis stated. She added, "I knew it in my mind...I had to take a break because I wasn't the happiest person."

312.title: It will play key role in Cong's rejuvenation: Sonia Gandhi on 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'
312.article_body: Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' will play a decisive role in the rejuvenation of Congress, party interim President Sonia Gandhi said. "It's going to be a transformational moment in the history of Indian politics," Sonia Gandhi added. "Those who cannot be physically present will participate...in thought and spirit. Come, let's take a pledge to move forward united," she stated.

313.title: Jammu professor accused of sexually harassing students dies by suicide
313.article_body: A 45-year-old associate professor at the University of Jammu allegedly died by suicide on Wednesday, police said. This comes a day after he was suspended following a complaint of sexual harassment against him by some students. Police found his body hanging inside his residential quarter, an official said. The deceased had been staying with his family on the university campus.

314.title: Thief steals bank's intranet router mistaking it for video recorder in G'gram
314.article_body: Daily operations at State Bank of India's (SBI) branch in Gurugram's Narsinghpur were put on halt on Tuesday after a thief stole an intranet router mistaking it for a digital video recorder of CCTV camera, bank officials said. "Due to this, we had to shut the bank on Tuesday because no routine work could be done," senior bank official said.

315.title: This progress is not ordinary: PM Modi on India becoming world's 5th largest economy
315.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday said, "India has become fifth largest economy in the world. This progress is not ordinary and we need to maintain this enthusiasm." He said this while addressing an event in Gujarat virtually. India overtook UK and is now behind just the US, China, Japan and Germany.

316.title: Looking forward to starting from zero: Ajinkya Rahane
316.article_body: Veteran India batter Ajinkya Rahane, who will return to competitive cricket in the Duleep Trophy, has said that he's looking forward to starting from "zero". "I don't want to think about my past or future; it's about being in the moment," he added. Rahane picked a groin injury in IPL 2022 and hasn't played since then.

317.title: InterGlobe Aviation shares fall 3.3% on Gangwal's stake sale news
317.article_body: Shares of InterGlobe Aviation, the operator of IndiGo airline, fell by 3.3% to ₹1,919 apiece on BSE in Thursday's opening trade. This development followed news of IndiGo Co-founder Rakesh Gangwal, his family and their trust looking to sell a 2.8% stake in InterGlobe Aviation through a block deal. At 11.54 am, InterGlobe shares were trading at ₹1,933.35 apiece on BSE.

318.title: Hackers steal data of UP colleges, demand $1 million in crypto
318.article_body: Hackers allegedly stole data of multiple colleges run by KN Modi Foundation in Uttar Pradesh and demanded $1 million in cryptocurrency. According to Sandeep Kumar Yadav, an official of the foundation, the hackers stole personal data of students, parents and staff, along with bank details and confidential e-files. They encrypted all files in the server, added Yadav.

319.title: EU plans to cap Russian gas price as Putin threatens to cut supplies
319.article_body: The European Union has proposed a price cap on Russian gas after President Vladimir Putin threatened to cut all energy supplies. "We must cut Russia's revenues which Putin uses to finance this atrocious war in Ukraine," European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen said. Europe, which imports about 40% of gas from Russia, accused the country of weaponising energy supplies.

320.title: India hiked oil imports from Russia by 6 times to tackle inflation: FM
320.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Thursday said India increased oil imports from Russia to 12% from 2% earlier to tackle inflation, adding that central banks across the globe are working in tandem to tame inflation. She also defended the export duties on iron and steel, saying that it was done to bring prices down and "it has shown good results".

321.title: Let us know when it folds: Samsung during iPhone 14 series launch
321.article_body: As Apple launched its latest iPhone 14 series on Wednesday, Samsung Mobile US tweeted, "Let us know when it folds." Samsung had revealed its latest batch of foldable phones last month. In an apparent reference to the new Apple Watch Ultra, Samsung also tweeted, "Nice. A little boxy, but nice. We prefer a round shape ourselves. Classic."

322.title: 4-yr-old girl run over by school bus while getting off in Faridabad, dies
322.article_body: A four-year-old girl died after she was allegedly run over by her school bus while getting off near her house in Faridabad on Wednesday, police said. The incident took place around 2 pm on Narhavli road, police added. "We've registered a case against the bus driver on the complaint of the girl's family...driver is yet to be arrested," police stated.

323.title: Bomb threat rumour at Amritsar school, traced to 3 Class 9 students: Police
323.article_body: A bomb threat rumour at DAV Public School on Lawrence Road in Punjab's Amritsar was spread by three Class 9 students, police said. The rumours were traced to them within hours following which they were detained, police added. Notably, while the bomb rumour went viral on Instagram, another post on firing in the same school was shared on WhatsApp.

324.title: Famous 'Launda Naach' performer Ramachandra Manjhi passes away
324.article_body: Bhojpuri folk dancer and famous 'Launda Naach' performer Ramachandra Manjhi has passed away. In January 2021, he was awarded the Padma Shri in the field of Arts. Ramachandra Manjhi, who began his career as an actor, singer and dancer at the age of 12, had worked with and trained under the legendary Bhikhari Thakur.

325.title: So wrong: Sona after Ranbir-Alia not allowed to visit Ujjain temple
325.article_body: Singer Sona Mohapatra reacted after Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt did not visit the Mahakaleshwar temple in Ujjain due to protests over Ranbir's comments on consuming beef. Taking to Twitter, she wrote, "This is just so...wrong India. Let's not descend into ochlocracy...Sick & dangerous precedent to set and nothing heroic in any remote way."

326.title: You were mean to Ananya Panday on 'Koffee...': Ishaan tells Karan Johar
326.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar, on his show 'Koffee With Karan 7', asked Ishaan Khatter about him breaking up with actress Ananya Panday. To this, Ishaan replied, "Did I? You told Ananya...she broke up with me. I did watch that episode (featuring Ananya). You were rather mean to her." Ishaan told Karan he was "drilling and grilling" Ananya over their relationship.

327.title: Napoli stun Liverpool; Barca, Tottenham register wins in Champions League
327.article_body: Champions League group stage Matchday One concluded on Wednesday night with Barcelona, Tottenham, Atletico Madrid and Bayern Munich registering wins in their respective games. Liverpool, however, suffered a 1-4 defeat against Napoli. Notably, Barcelona registered the biggest win, scoring five goals against Czech side Viktoria Plzen. Robert Lewandowski scored thrice for the Catalans in their match.

328.title: S Korea offers to talk to N Korea to unify families separated during war
328.article_body: South Korea offered to hold talks with North Korea to discuss reunion of families who were separated during the 1950-53 Korean War. South Korea's Unification Minister Kwon Young-se said that Seoul will consider Pyongyang's preferences in deciding the date, venue, agenda and format of the talks. This comes at a time when North Korea is strengthening its weapons arsenal.

329.title: realme announces offers worth ₹700 crore for realme Festive Day sale
329.article_body: realme announced the realme Festive Days sale with offers worth ₹700 crore, including up to ₹10,000 discount on smartphones and up to ₹12,000 discount on AIoT products. Users can avail discounts through realme.com, Flipkart, Amazon, & mainline stores. It also introduced the realme Savings Pass, redeemable after the sale goes live for benefits worth ₹1000, plus additional benefits.

330.title: Went to buy undergarments: J'khand CM's brother on his Delhi visit amid political crisis
330.article_body: Responding to a question on his Delhi visit during the political crisis in Jharkhand, CM Hemant Soren's brother Basant said, "I had run out of undergarments, so I went to Delhi to purchase them. I get them from Delhi." MLAs of ruling coalition in Jharkhand were taken to a resort in Congress-ruled Chhattisgarh last month amid fear of defection.

331.title: Mumbai woman loses ₹3.8 lakh trying to buy wine online
331.article_body: A 47-year-old woman from Mumbai's Bandra was cheated of ₹3.8 lakh while trying to order wine worth ₹2,000 online, said police. She dialled the number of what she believed to be a local wine outlet she found on Google. The fraudster tricked her into revealing her bank details and OTP, after which the money was debited.

332.title: IMD predicts heavy rain in B'luru for next 2 days, says worst not over yet
332.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) predicted heavy rainfall in Bengaluru for the next two days and said that the "worst is not over yet". According to the weather office, the city recorded 251.4 mm of rain in the last four days. Bengaluru witnessed 131.6 mm of rainfall on Sunday, the highest 24-hour precipitation in September in 34 years, IMD said.

333.title: There will always be professional critics: Cong's Jairam on 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'
333.article_body: Reacting to the BJP's criticism of the party's 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', Congress' Jairam Ramesh said the party has only one vision right now, which is to ensure the successful completion of the yatra. "There will always be professional critics, arm-chair critics and people who will raise questions in India for everything you do," Ramesh added.

334.title: Started business of selling & buying phones at 14: Zerodha's billionaire Co-founder Nikhil
334.article_body: Zerodha's billionaire Co-founder Nikhil Kamath revealed that he started a business of buying and selling phones at the age of 14 with his friend and soon after dropped out of school. Nikhil said that at the age of 17 he bagged a job at a call centre that paid him ₹8,000 and at 18, he began trading stocks properly.

335.title: 19-year-old gives birth to twins from two different fathers in Brazil
335.article_body: A 19-year-old Brazilian woman gave birth to twins from two different fathers. The woman said she had intercourse with two men on the same day. Her doctor said, "It is possible to happen when two eggs from the same mother are fertilised by different men. The babies share the mother's genetic material, but they grow in different placentas."

336.title: Innovative, high-potential vaccine: Dr VK Paul on nasal COVID-19 vaccine
336.article_body: After Bharat Biotech's nasal COVID-19 vaccine got approval for primary immunisation against COVID-19 in 18+ age group for restricted use in emergency situation, NITI Aayog's Dr VK Paul said India has set an example before world by developing the "innovative and high-potential" vaccine. "This is another tool to fight against COVID-19...This is a story of self-reliance...self-confidence," he added.

337.title: If content isn't good, the film doesn't work: Ranbir on 'Shamshera'
337.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor, speaking about the boycott trend against him, has said that he did not feel negativity when his film 'Shamshera' had released. "If the film didn't run at the box office, it's only because the audience didn't like the film. Eventually, it's about the content," the 'Brahmastra' actor added. 'Shamshera' also featured Vaani Kapoor and Sanjay Dutt.

338.title: It was a great experience: Shubman Gill on 92(148) on county debut
338.article_body: India batter Shubman Gill, who's currently playing for Glamorgan in the County Championship Division Two, scored 92 off 148 balls on his debut in the tournament. "It was a great experience for me...the conditions are different to back home, especially with the rain," said Gill. "Disappointed to be out on 92, but pretty satisfied with my performance," he added.

339.title: Mumbai reports 316 new COVID-19 cases, 3 deaths
339.article_body: Mumbai reported 316 new COVID-19 infections in a day, taking the cumulative total to 11,47,041 cases, the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) said on Wednesday. The city saw three deaths due to the infection, taking the overall toll to 19,714. As many as 17 more patients were hospitalised, while the number of active cases stood at 2,218.

340.title: 4 arrested after attack on history-sheeter in Pune hospital
340.article_body: Four people have been arrested after they attacked 35-year-old history-sheeter Tushar Hambir, who was undergoing treatment at Pune's Sassoon Hospital on Monday, said police. Two persons, including a policeman, were injured in the incident. The attack was the result of a gang rivalry, according to police. One of the attackers tried to shoot Hambir but the weapon malfunctioned, said police.

341.title: IMD issues orange alert for Hyderabad till Sunday; many areas waterlogged
341.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) issued an orange alert for Hyderabad until Sunday (September 11) predicting heavy rain in the city. Meanwhile, several areas of Hyderabad including Banjara Hills, Khairatabad faced severe waterlogging on Wednesday. "Movement of traffic is slow from North Zone, YMCA, SBH X Roads, Paradise X Roads towards Anand Theatre," the traffic police said on Thursday.

342.title: Centre approves ₹27,360 cr to develop schools under PM-SHRI scheme
342.article_body: Centre on Wednesday approved a ₹27,360 crore Pradhan Mantri Schools For Rising India (PM-SHRI) scheme for the upgradation of 14,500 schools across the country. The total project includes a central share of ₹18,128 crore for the period of five years from 2022-23 to 2026-27. The school selection process will involve three stages with definite timelines.

343.title: India reports 6,395 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 50,342
343.article_body: India has reported 6,395 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 5,379 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in India stand at 50,342, while the death toll has risen to 5,28,090, according to the latest data.

344.title: Man pretending to be Andhra MP's PA breaches Amit Shah's security during Mumbai visit
344.article_body: A man who claimed to be the personal assistant of an MP from Andhra Pradesh has been arrested for allegedly breaching the security of Home Minister Amit Shah during his two-day visit to Mumbai. Police said Hemant Pawar, 32, was seen moving around Shah and other politicians at Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis's official residence on Monday.

345.title: Gulf states warn Netflix to remove content violating 'Islamic values'
345.article_body: Saudi Arabia and other countries of Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC) have ordered Netflix to remove all content that violates "Islamic and societal values" in the region. GCC didn't name the content but said it included material directed at children. While discussing the issue, a state-run Saudi channel featured clips from an animated Netflix show that showed a same-sex relationship.

346.title: Mercedes-Benz to fire 3,600 employees in Brazil
346.article_body: Mercedes-Benz on Tuesday said it will fire 3,600 workers in Brazil under its plans of restructuring its truck and bus chassis plant in São Paulo. Further, the company said it plans to outsource logistics and maintenance services and production of certain components at the plant to cut costs. It added that it will give priority to local companies for outsourcing.

347.title: Vicky danced to my songs for 45 minutes on my b'day: Katrina Kaif
347.article_body: Actress Katrina Kaif revealed that her husband Vicky Kaushal danced to her songs for 45 minutes on her birthday. "I was just recovering from being very unwell. I had a very tough time with COVID-19," she stated. "He could sense that I was not having a good time...He did a 45-minute concert of every single song of mine," Katrina added.

348.title: Believers in British policies are working to spread poison in country: Baghel
348.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel on Wednesday said that believers in British policies are spreading poison and attempting to divide the country.
