As Congress' Rahul Gandhi flagged off the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' yesterday, Baghel, while addressing a public meeting, said that Gandhi has launched the "padyatra" to once again spread the message of unity.

349.title: FM Nirmala Sitharaman meets IMF MD to discuss regulation of crypto
349.article_body: In a meeting with International Monetary Fund (IMF) Managing Director Kristalina Georgieva, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman urged IMF to play a lead role in crypto assets regulation. They discussed the need to have a globally coordinated, synchronised approach on the issue. India's upcoming G20 Presidency was also discussed with Georgieva calling India "a bright spot in the global economy".

350.title: Tiafoe becomes 1st American man to reach US Open semis since 2006
350.article_body: World number 26 Frances Tiafoe has become the first American man since 2006 to reach the semi-finals at the US Open. Tiafoe defeated world number 11 Andrey Rublev 7-6(7-3), 7-6(7-0), 6-4 in two-hour and 35 minutes on Wednesday night. "This is wild. This is crazy," said Tiafoe, who had defeated Rafael Nadal in the fourth round, in his on-court interview.

351.title: New rail overbridge on Delhi-Meerut Expressway to open by Sept 15: Officials
351.article_body: The under-construction rail overbridge (ROB) in Chipiyana, on Delhi-Meerut Expressway (DME), is likely to open by September 15, National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) officials said. With the opening of ROB, the existing toll charges on DME's Phase 2 (from UP Gate to Dasna) will increase as the authority is presently charging only 75% of the proposed rates, officials added.

352.title: Musk can use whistleblower's claims but cannot delay Twitter trial: Judge
352.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk can use a whistleblower's allegations in his legal case but the trial over the $44 billion deal for Twitter cannot be delayed, ruled a judge. "I am convinced that even four weeks' delay would risk further harm to Twitter," wrote Chancellor Kathaleen McCormick of Delaware's Court of Chancery. The lawsuit goes to trial on October 17.

353.title: It was my truth: Siddhant Chaturvedi on his nepotism jibe at Ananya Panday
353.article_body: Actor Siddhant Chaturvedi, during his appearance on 'Koffee With Karan 7', opened up about his statement regarding nepotism on Ananya Panday. "There was no intention to kind of harm anybody...I thought it was just my truth and I will always speak my truth because I mean yes, you know it's (the journey) been a bit difficult," he stated.

354.title: Daughter's plea to stay with mother accused in Sheena Bora case rejected
354.article_body: A Mumbai court on Wednesday rejected Vidhie Mukerjea's plea seeking permission to live with her mother Indrani Mukerjea, the prime accused in the Sheena Bora murder case, on her return to India. Vidhie has been living in London and is returning to India on September 10, as per her application. Indrani is currently out on bail in the case.

355.title: When I went in to bat I had the belief to hit the sixes: Naseem Shah
355.article_body: Talking about his two back-to-back sixes against Afghanistan in the final over, Pakistan's 19-year-old pacer Naseem Shah said he had the self-belief to hit the sixes to help his side win. "This will be a memorable game for me," he added. Pakistan required 11 off the final over to win with one wicket in hand when Naseem smashed the sixes.

356.title: Afghanistan fans break chairs, attack Pak fans at stadium after defeat; video goes viral
356.article_body: A video went viral showing Afghanistan fans breaking chairs and attacking Pakistani fans at the stadium in Sharjah after Pakistan defeated Afghanistan by one wicket in their Asia Cup 2022 Super 4 match on Wednesday. Earlier in the match, Pakistan's Asif Ali and Afghanistan's Fareed Ahmad Malik were involved in a fight, with Asif almost hitting Fareed with the bat.

357.title: Thanks for reminding: Shastri on Babar comparing Naseem's sixes to Miandad's six vs India
357.article_body: While being interviewed by Ravi Shastri, Pakistan captain Babar Azam compared Naseem Shah's two sixes in last over against Afghanistan to that of Javed Miandad's last-ball six against India in 1986 Austral-Asia Cup final. Shastri responded, "I was there...thanks for reminding." With Pakistan needing 11 runs to win off the last over, Naseem slammed two sixes on first two deliveries.

358.title: Man steals gold ring from Pune shop, buys smaller ring to mislead
358.article_body: A man stole a 12 gram gold ring worth ₹66,714 from a jewellery shop in Pune while pretending to be a customer. To throw off the lone saleswoman in the shop at the time, the man bought a 0.5 gram gold ring and left. The CCTV camera footage showed the man, who was not wearing a mask.

359.title: IndiGo Co-founder, Gangwal family to sell 2.8% stake for $250 mn
359.article_body: IndiGo Co-founder Rakesh Gangwal, his family and their trust will sell a 2.8% stake in InterGlobe Aviation through a block deal for $250 million. As many as 10.8 million shares have been listed for sale at ₹1,850 apiece, a discount of 6.5% as against InterGlobe Aviation's closing price of ₹1,977.7 on the National Stock Exchange on Wednesday.

360.title: Multiple shootings reported in US' Memphis, 19-yr-old gunman goes live on Facebook
360.article_body: Multiple shootings have been reported in US' Memphis, with police saying that the 19-year-old gunman went live on Facebook. Ezekiel Kelly, who has been taken into custody, was arrested after crashing his car near Ivan Road and Hodge Road. There has been no word on a motive or if there were any injuries related to the shooting spree.

361.title: Maybe he wants to help BJP: Nitish Kumar on Prashant Kishor
361.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar, while responding to a question about poll strategist Prashant Kishor, said, "Whatever statements he has been making...maybe he wants to stay with BJP. Maybe, he wants to help them." He called Kishor a "publicity expert". Kumar added, "Working with other political parties is his business...Does he know 'ABC' of what all has been done since 2005?"

362.title: We didn't control our nerves at the end: Nabi on last-over defeat vs Pakistan
362.article_body: Afghanistan captain Mohammad Nabi said they couldn't hold their nerves at the end during their Asia Cup Super 4 match against Pakistan. "The bowling and the fielding was brilliant, but we didn't finish well," he added. Pakistan needed 11 runs in the last over with one wicket remaining when Naseem Shah smashed two back-to-back sixes to help his side win.

363.title: Steve Jobs' daughter Eve posts meme to troll Apple after iPhone 14 launch
363.article_body: Apple Founder Steve Jobs' daughter Eve posted a meme to troll the company after the launch of iPhone 14. The meme shows a man posing with a shirt identical to the one he is wearing. "Me upgrading from iPhone 13 to iPhone 14 after Apple's announcement today," the meme posted by Eve read.

364.title: How much will iPhone 13 and iPhone 13 mini cost in India after today's price cut?
364.article_body: Apple's iPhone 13 will now cost ₹69,900 for the 128GB variant and ₹79,900 for 256GB after the company launched the 14 series lineup on Wednesday. The iPhone 13 mini now costs ₹64,900 and ₹74,900 for 128GB and 256GB, respectively. Meanwhile, iPhone 13 with 512GB storage will now cost ₹99,900 and iPhone 13 mini with 512 GB storage will cost ₹94,900.

365.title: How much will iPhone 14, iPhone 14 Plus, iPhone 14 Pro & iPhone 14 Pro Max cost in India?
365.article_body: Apple's 6.1-inch iPhone 14 will start from ₹79,900 and go up to ₹1,09,900. The 6.7-inch iPhone 14 Plus will start from ₹89,900 and go up to ₹1,19,900. The 6.1-inch iPhone 14 Pro starts from ₹1,29,900 and goes up to ₹1,79,900. The 6.7-inch display iPhone 14 Pro Max starts from ₹1,39,900 and goes up to ₹1,89,900.

366.title: Substantial size of users fake: Ex-Disney CEO on why they didn't buy Twitter in 2016
366.article_body: Speaking about why Disney didn't acquire Twitter in 2016, former CEO Bob Iger said that a "substantial amount, but not a majority" of Twitter users were fake accounts. He added, "I got cold feet for the right reasons...I thought we'd be taking on responsibility that we shouldn't take on." Meanwhile, reacting to his remarks, Tesla CEO Elon Musk tweeted, "Interesting."

367.title: Traffic movement to be restricted in Hyderabad on Sept 9-10 for Ganesh Visarjan
367.article_body: The Hyderabad Traffic Police issued advisory ahead of Ganesh Visarjan on September 9 and September 10 imposing restrictions on several roads and areas of the city. As per the advisory, all heavy vehicles (including buses) from Sangareddy, Patancheru and BHEL proceeding to Kukatpally, Hyderabad City will not be allowed. Vehicles carrying Ganesh idols will not be allowed on Fathenagar flyover.

368.title: Germany's Scholz invites new UK PM to Berlin for inaugural visit
368.article_body: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz and UK's newly elected Prime Minister Liz Truss held a phone conversation on Wednesday. Scholz invited Truss to Berlin for an inaugural visit. The two leaders discussed energy crisis, Russian invasion of Ukraine and the Northern Ireland Protocol. "The Prime Minister underlined the importance of ensuring democracy and freedom were upheld in Europe," UK government said.

369.title: Self-assessment is needed in B'wood about what we're making: Pankaj
369.article_body: Speaking about Bollywood films not working in recent times, actor Pankaj Tripathi has said that self-assessment is needed about what they are making. Opening up about the ongoing 'boycott Bollywood' trend on Twitter, Pankaj stated, "If a film is bad, it doesn't work and doesn't get boycotted. People don't go to the cinema halls. That's also a boycott...isn't it?"

370.title: Elected officials, police chiefs on US extremist group's leaked members list
370.article_body: The Anti-Defamation League Centre on Extremism analysed over 38,000 names on a leaked membership list of Oath Keepers, a far-right extremist group in US. The list included names of elected officials and police chiefs. More than 370 people are believed to be working with law enforcement agencies. More than 100 people are members of the military.

371.title: NEET-UG 2022 results declared; Rajasthan's Tanishka emerges topper
371.article_body: National Testing Agency has announced the medical entrance exam NEET-UG 2022 results. While 17,64,571 candidates appeared, 9,93,069 have passed. Maximum qualifying candidates are from Uttar Pradesh, followed by Maharashtra. Rajasthan's Tanishka has emerged as the topper of the entrance test, despite four candidates scoring equal marks. Vatsa Ashish Batra from Delhi has secured the second position.

372.title: Mumbai diagnostic lab staffer cheated of ₹49,500 via Google Pay
372.article_body: A 27-year-old woman working at a diagnostic centre in Mumbai was cheated of ₹49,500 by a man who said he wanted to get blood tests done for 25 people. The victim was instructed over a video call to open her Google Pay app and select the "Pay bills" option. A case has been registered by Mumbai Police.

373.title: Leopard spotted on campus of defence institute in Pune
373.article_body: A leopard was sighted on the campus of Defence Institute of Advanced Technology (DIAT) in Pune on Tuesday night. According to DIAT officials, security personnel saw the leopard on a tree after they were alerted by the barking of dogs. "Security guards also recorded a video of the leopard getting down from the tree," said an officer.

374.title: IMD issues yellow alert for Pune till September 11
374.article_body: India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a 'yellow' alert for the Pune district till September 11, warning of heavy rain, thunder, lightning and gusty winds. Notably, Pune's Shivajinagar recorded 42.8 mm of rainfall from 8.30 am to 11.30 pm on Wednesday. IMD has also issued a 'yellow' alert for Palghar, Thane, Mumbai, Nashik and other districts till Sunday.

375.title: Pharma company GSK fires employee after viral video of his abusive rant on flight
375.article_body: Pharmaceutical and biotech company GlaxoSmithKline fired one of its employees after he was caught on camera yelling homophobic and racist slurs on a Philadelphia-Dallas flight. The chemical engineer was seen shouting profanities at fellow passengers while being removed from the flight. Before getting off the plane, he also declared that he is a chemical engineer who works for GlaxoSmithKline.

376.title: 30-yr-old wanted for stabbing 10 people to death in Canada dies soon after arrest
376.article_body: The suspect sought by Canadian authorities in a stabbing incident that killed 10 people was arrested on Wednesday but suffered unspecified "medical distress" and died a short time later at a hospital. The Royal Canadian Mounted Police added that Myles Sanderson, 30, was arrested near the town of Rosthern, Saskatchewan. Earlier, Myles' brother, also a suspect, was found dead.

377.title: BESCOM blames ad firm for woman's electrocution in Bengaluru
377.article_body: Two days after a 22-year-old woman died of electrocution on a waterlogged road, Bangalore Electricity Supply Company (BESCOM) told the police that it was not responsible for the incident. "They have put the blame on an advertisement agency saying it was the wiring from the billboard attached to the electric post that led to the electrocution," the police said.

378.title: Harbhajan Singh helps in rescuing 21-year-old Punjab girl held captive in Oman
378.article_body: Rajya Sabha MP Harbhajan Singh helped in rescuing 21-year-old Punjab girl named Kamaljeet Kaur, who was "illegally held" in Oman. The ex-cricketer collaborated with Indian Embassy in Oman for her rescue. Kamaljeet had approached a local agent in Punjab, who promised her job of cook for an Indian family in Oman. However, when she reached Oman, she was held captive.

379.title: Rahul Gandhi to sleep in container for 150 days of 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'
379.article_body: During the 150-day 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', Congress' Rahul Gandhi will stay and sleep in a container. As per ANI, Congress has denied that Rahul will put up in hotels during the nationwide 'yatra'. Instead, containers have been prepared to accommodate the Congress MP and other party leaders who will accompany him on the yatra.

380.title: 3 men trimming tree electrocuted as iron trolley touches wire in Delhi
380.article_body: At least three men were electrocuted after an iron trolley that they were using to trim leaves of trees at a farmhouse, used for hosting wedding functions, in Delhi's Bawana came in contact with a live wire, police said. While two of the victims were trimming the tree leaves using the trolley, the third victim had come to their rescue.

381.title: Scolded for coming late, Class 10 boy hits school guard with rod in Delhi
381.article_body: A Class 10 student allegedly attacked a guard of his school with an iron rod in Delhi's Tilak Nagar on Wednesday after being scolded for coming late to school. The 32-year-old guard, Vijay Kumar, sustained minor injury and was hospitalised. The 16-year-old boy had got into an argument with Kumar two days ago for coming late to school, police said.

382.title: Apple to release iOS 16 with redesigned lock screen on September 12
382.article_body: Apple has announced that it will be releasing its latest operating system iOS 16 on September 12. iOS 16 will allow users to add widgets to the lock screen, use the Live Text feature to pull text from videos and photos and edit and recall messages sent on iMessage. It'll also offer passkeys as an easier and safer sign-in method.

383.title: Pakistan's Asif Ali fights with Afghan bowler, almost hits him with bat; video viral
383.article_body: Pakistan's Asif Ali pushed Afghanistan fast bowler Fareed Ahmad Malik after the latter dismissed him in their Asia Cup 2022 match on Wednesday. A video has gone viral showing Fareed giving Asif a send-off after which Asif pushes him and almost hits him with his bat. Other Afghanistan players and the umpire intervened and separated Asif and Fareed.

384.title: Apple unveils iPhone 14 Pro, iPhone 14 Pro Max starting from $999 & $1,099
384.article_body: Apple unveiled iPhone 14 Pro and iPhone 14 Pro Max smartphones starting from $999 and $1,099 respectively. The phones come with 6.1-inch and 6.7-inch screens with always-on display and have a new pill-shaped cut-out called the 'Dynamic Island'. The phones also feature a 48MP main camera. They will come in four different colours.

385.title: Apple unveils iPhone 14, iPhone 14 Plus starting from $799 and $899
385.article_body: Apple unveiled the iPhone 14 with a 6.1-inch display and iPhone 14 Plus with a 6.7-inch display starting from $799 and $899, respectively. They come with a familiar notch at the top and a new 12MP main camera and new front camera with auto-focus. The iPhone 14 also has new sensors that can detect a car crash.

386.title: Apple unveils 2nd generation AirPods Pro with 6-hour listening time costing $249
386.article_body: Apple on Wednesday unveiled the second generation AirPods Pro costing $249, marking the first update for the Pro model since the initial launch in 2019. The new AirPods Pro can cancel twice as much noise and allow six hours of listening on a single charge. It comes with swipe controls on the stems and a speaker in its charging case.

387.title: Apple unveils second-generation Apple Watch SE starting from $249
387.article_body: Apple has unveiled the second-generation Apple Watch SE model starting from $249. The Apple Watch SE, with a 30% larger display than the Series 3, will have fall detection, crash detection, family setup and activity tracking along with Emergency SOS. It'll feature the S8 chip and will cost $249 for the GPS model and $299 for the cellular model.

388.title: Apple unveils Apple Watch Ultra for extreme sports costing $799
388.article_body: Apple has unveiled Apple Watch Ultra with a 49 mm titanium case and a customisable action button, which will cost $799. It has been specifically designed for intense sports tracking. The Apple Watch Ultra is WR-100 water resistant and it has an automatic built-in depth gauge. It's also EN13319 certified, which means it can be used as a dive computer.

389.title: At least $1 billion required to avert famine in Somalia: UN
389.article_body: At least $1 billion is urgently needed to avert a famine in Somalia, the United Nations (UN) said. The warning comes as two more dry seasons are predicted for the country. UN official Martin Griffiths said this new funding requirement is separate from the UN's recent appeal of about $1.4 billion in emergency aid to the country.

390.title: Pandemic increased waitlist by 3-fold at AIIMS' corneal transplant centre: Chief doctor
390.article_body: The number of patients waiting for corneal transplant at Dr RP Centre for Ophthalmic Sciences, AIIMS, has increased by three-fold due to the COVID-19 pandemic, the centre's chief Dr JS Titiyal said. The National Eye Bank at the institute saw 88 per cent utilisation rate of corneas in 2021, which was higher than the national average of 67 per cent.

391.title: Govt to tighten rules over fake, paid reviews on social media
391.article_body: The Indian government has decided to tighten rules regarding fake and/or paid reviews on e-commerce websites and social media. Rohit Kumar Singh from India's consumer affairs department said that the government will soon announce a framework of regulations targeting people who are paid for endorsements. He added that those endorsing will be held liable in issues related to the product.

392.title: Nearly 380 killed in tribal clashes in Sudan this year: UN
392.article_body: The United Nations (UN) has said nearly 380 people have been killed in tribal clashes in Sudan from January to August this year. Over 430 people were injured in the same period, which saw 224 violent incidents in 12 of the 18 provinces of the country. Most of the violence was reported from conflict-hit Darfur region.

393.title: 2 die after car runs over labourers sleeping on footpath in UP
393.article_body: Two labourers died and one was injured after a speeding SUV ran over labourers who were asleep on a footpath in Uttar Pradesh's Gorakhpur, the police said. All four people travelling in the car were arrested by the police. They added that the SUV lost control and hit the railing of the Gorakhnath overbridge, before running over the sleeping labourers.

394.title: India crash out of Asia Cup 2022 final race as Pakistan defeat Afghanistan in last over
394.article_body: India have crashed out of the Asia Cup 2022 final race after Pakistan defeated Afghanistan in the last over in their Super 4 stage match on Wednesday. Afghanistan are also officially out of the final race. The final will now be played between Pakistan and Sri Lanka on Sunday. India and Afghanistan will face each other in dead-rubber encounter tomorrow.

395.title: Apple unveils Watch Series 8 with car crash detection starting from $399
395.article_body: Apple has unveiled the Apple Watch Series 8 starting from $399. The new model is capable of detecting a car crash and notifying emergency services and emergency contacts. The Series 8 features an always-on display with narrow edges, and is crack-resistant and swim-proof. The Watch Series 8 comes with temperature sensors and new cycle tracking feature to help track ovulation.

396.title: SC's Justice Chandrachud-led Constitution bench to go paperless
396.article_body: The Supreme Court's Constitution bench has decided to go completely paperless while hearing the Centre and the Delhi government dispute over administrative control. The five-judge bench led by Justice DY Chandrachud also said that the Information Technology cell of the court agreed to train seniors on the use of technology. The court has also allowed the proceedings to be recorded.

397.title: Some chimpanzees are rock drummers, some jazz: Study
397.article_body: A new study has found that chimpanzees use their feet and hands to drum out messages to one another on tree roots. Moreover, they also have their signature styles of drumming that resemble rock or jazz rhythms. The study revealed this skill helps them to spread information over long distances, indicating their location and what they are doing.

398.title: NIA announces ₹10 lakh bounty on fugitive terrorist Harpreet Singh
398.article_body: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) on Wednesday announced a cash reward of ₹10 lakh for any information leading to the arrest of fugitive terrorist Harpreet Singh alias 'Happy Malaysia', who is accused in the 2021 Ludhiana court complex blast. He's currently is Malaysia, the NIA said. It added that he's associated with International Sikh Youth Federation, which planned the blast.

399.title: 21L farmers found ineligible for farm support scheme: UP Minister
399.article_body: Of the 2.85 crore farmers selected under the Centre's Pradhan Mantri Kisan Samman Nidhi scheme in Uttar Pradesh, 21 lakh have been found ineligible, said state Agriculture Minister Surya Pratap Shahi on Wednesday. The money transferred to the ineligible beneficiaries will be recovered, Shahi said. Under the scheme, ₹6,000 income support is given to all land-holding farmer families annually.

400.title: Govt extends ceasefire agreement with Naga insurgent group for a year
400.article_body: The central government has extended the ceasefire agreement with National Socialist Council of Nagaland (K) Niki group, a break-away faction of the Nagaland insurgent group NSCN, by another year. The decision was announced by the Union Home Ministry on Wednesday. NSCN (K) Niki is led by Niki Sumi, who is accused of killing 18 Indian soldiers in Manipur in 2015.

401.title: Lucknow's Levana Suites sealed after fire killed 4 people
401.article_body: The Lucknow Development Authority on Wednesday sealed the Levana Suites hotel where a fire accident killed four people on Monday. The authority is said to have found several building norm violations and has recommended action against responsible persons. The police on Tuesday had arrested hotel owners Rahul and Rohit Agarwal and General Manager Sagar Srivastava.

402.title: US, India will work for free and open Indo-Pacific: White House
402.article_body: The US will partner with India to advance a free and open Indo-Pacific, the White House has said. Press Secretary Karin Jean-Pierre said India and the US are partners in important areas, including climate, defence, vaccines and technology. The comments come as China is engaged in several territorial disputes in the South China Sea (SCS) and the East China Sea.
